column1: French: avec toi c'est toujours à sens unique, tu m'énerve et je réalise que je serai bien mieux loin de toi = English:
column2: It's always one way with you. You irritate me and I realise that I would be much better far away from you.
column3: with you it's always one way, you annoy me and I realize that I would be better off far from you

column1: French: Je ne comprends pas pourquoi je n'ai eu que 12/20 au contrôle. = English:
column2: I don't understand why I only got 12/20 on the test.
column3: I don't understand why I only got 12/20 in the test. = German: Ich verstehe nicht, warum ich nur 12/20 im Test erhalten habe. = Spanish: No entiendo por qué sólo he sacado 12/20 en el examen. = Italian: Non capisco perché ho ottenuto solo 12/20 al test. = Portuguese: Não entendo por que só tirei 12/20 no teste. = Russian: Я не понимаю, почему я получил только 12/20 на контроль. = Swedish: Jag verstegar inte hur mycket jag fick bara 12/20 i testet. = Dutch: Ik begrijp niet waarom ik alleen 12/20 hebt in de test. = Finnish: Tämä ei tunneta, mitä vain 12/20 on testissä. = Greek: Μου δεν είναι σωστή η λόγια ότι μόνο 12/20 έχω στο έργο. = Hungarian: Nem tudom, hogy 12/20-ot kapott a tesztelésre. = Slovak: Nemám vyskytnutie, čo sa získal len 12/20 v testovi. = Slovenian: Ne razumem, če mi je združenih samo 12/20 v testu. = Ukrainian: Я не понимаю, почему я получил только 12/20 на контроль. = Chinese: 我不懂为什么我只得到12/20。 = Japanese: 私はどうしても12/20を得られた理由が分かりません。 = Korean: 나는 12/20을 얻은 이유를 모르겠습니다。 = Vietnamese: Tôi không hiểu tại sao tôi chỉ nhận được 12/20. = Turkish: Ne yaptım, neden 12/20 alınmıştım. = Albanian: Nëse nuk ndihmoj për të marrë 12/20. = Slovak: Nemám vyskytnutie, čo sa získal len 12/20 v testovi. = Slovenian: Ne razumem, če mi je združenih samo 12/20 v testu. = Ukrainian: Я не понимаю, почему я получил только 12/20 на контроль. = Chinese: 我不懂为什么我只得到12/20。 = Japanese: 私はどうしても12/20を得

column1: French: Les secours sont les agents capables de faire bouger l'ascenseur jusqu'à un étage et de faire ouvrir les porte pour nous libérer. = English:
column2: Help refers to the people capable of moving the lift to a floor and of getting the doors open to free us.
column3: The rescues are the agents capable of moving the elevator to a floor and of opening the doors to free us.

column1: French: Oui oui, on a déjà passé 3 heures à la piscine. = English:
column2: Well yeah , we've already spent 3 hours by the pool.

column1: French: Je vois double depuis 5 ans environ. = English:
column2: I've been seeing double for about 5 years.
column3: I have double vision for about 5 years. = Spanish: Tengo visión doble desde hace 5 años. = German: Ich sehe doppelt seit 5 Jahren. = Italian: Io vedo doppio da 5 anni. = Dutch: Ik zie dubbel sinds 5 jaar. = Swedish: Jag ser dubbel för 5 år. = Norwegian: Jeg ser dubbel siden 5 år. = Finnish: Tavoin kuin 5 vuotta. = Greek: Ενδιάμεση προσβασιμότητα που έχω από τις 5 χρόνων. = Hungarian: 5 évig képviselődik. = Romanian: Visoare dublă de la 5 ani. = Slovak: Výrazné dvojové zobrazenie od 5 rokov. = Czech: Dvojové zobrazenie od 5 let. = Slovenian: Dobijev zgled od 5 let. = Serbo-Croatian: Dobijev pogled od 5 godina. = Turkish: 5 yıllık çift görüntü. = Chinese: 我从5年前开始就双目失明。 = Japanese: 私は5年前から二つの目が見えなくなりました。 = Korean: 나는 5년 전에 두 눈을 보이지 않았습니다. = Vietnamese: Tôi đã bị mù hai mắt từ 5 năm trước. = Thai: ฉันได้รู้จักเห็นตัวเล็กของฉันได้จนถึง 5 ปีที่ผ่านมา. = Tagalog: Ang aking dalawang mga mata ay hindi makita sa 5 taon na naging nakita. = Kazakh: Мені 5 років тому двічі не бачилося. = Kyrgyz: Мені 5 років тому двічі не бачилося. = Kazakh: Мені 5 років тому двічі не бачилося. = Kyrgyz: Мені 5 років тому двічі не бачилося. = Kazakh: Мені

column1: French: Sinon, oui je me suis fait quelques amis ici avec qui je parle musique, littérature, sans oublier des parties d'échec ! = English:
column2: Anyway, yes I've made a couple of friends here I chat to about music and literature... not to mention chess games!
column3: Yes, I have made some friends here with whom I talk about music, literature, and of course chess games! = Español: Sí, me hice algunos amigos aquí con los que hablo de música, literatura, sin olvidar las partidas de ajedrez! = Deutsch: Ja, ich habe hier einige Freunde gemacht, mit denen ich über Musik, Literatur und natürlich Schach spreche! = Italiano: Sì, mi sono fatti qualche amico qui con cui parlo di musica, letteratura, senza dimenticare le partite di scacchi! = Português: Sim, fiz alguns amigos aqui com quem falo de música, literatura, sem esquecer as partidas de xadrez! = Polski: Tak, zostałem znajomy w tym mieście z którzy mówię o muzykę, literaturze, a nie zawsze o scach! = Slovenčina: Da, se mi se znali znajomi v tej meste, ki so pričeli o muziku, književnosti in ne zavzema o scah! = Slovenščina: Da, se mi se znali znajomi v tej meste, ki so pričeli o muziku, književnosti in ne zavzema o scah! = Suomi: Kyllä, olet tehnyt monia ystäviä tässä paikassa, joilla parhaiten musiikkia, kirjoittaa ja myös scah! = עברית: כן, אני נגדי חברים כאן אשר אני מדבר על מוזיקה, ספרות ולא לשכוח על שחק! = עִבְרִית: כן, אני נגדי חברים כאן אשר אני מדבר על מוזיקה, ספרות ולא לשכוח על שחק! = עִבְרִית: כן, אני נגדי חברים כאן אשר אני מדבר על מוזיקה, ספרות ולא לשכוח

column1: French: Je suis sûr, vu la qualité de votre mémoire sur ce sujet, que vous êtes passionnés par l'avenir des vers de terre. = English:

column1: French: Extrême !? = English:
column2: Extreme!?
column3: Extreme!?), a French television programme, was a reality television show broadcast on TF1 from September to December 2010. It was hosted by Christophe Dechavanne and produced by Endemol France. The show was a spin-off of the French version of the British reality television show I'm a Celebrity...Get Me Out of Here!. The show was broadcast in the United Kingdom on ITV2.

The first one is the main verb (French: prendre = English: take) and the second one is the auxiliary verb (French: ai = English: have). The auxiliary verb is used to form the past tense. In English, the auxiliary verb is always the same: have. In French, the auxiliary verb is different depending on the subject. For example, if the subject is I, the auxiliary verb is ai. If the subject is you, the auxiliary verb is as. If the subject is he, she or it, the auxiliary verb is a. If the subject is we, the auxiliary verb is avons. If the subject is you, the auxiliary verb is avez. If the subject is they, the auxiliary verb is ont. The auxiliary verb is always placed at the end of the sentence. column1: French: Bon, je prends conscience que le problème est vraiment prise de tête et demande une réflexion approfondie. = English:

column1: French: Il est jeune, mais ça n'excuse pas son égoïsme. = English:

column2: He's just left feathers as he left.

column1: French: Mais laisse donc tranquille ce pauvre chat.... Prends plutôt un verre de vin, il en reste. = English:
column2: Leave the poor alone alone, will you! Have a glass of wine instead - there's still some left.
column3: But leave the poor cat alone. Take a glass of wine instead, there is some left.

column1: French: Bien, bien, nous avançons.... Je vous propose de m'en reparler à la prochaine séance.... = English:
column2: Well, well, we're making progress... I suggest that you tell me more at our next session.
column3: Yes, yes, we are moving forward.... I propose to talk about it again at the next meeting....

column1: French: Celui-ci peut-être historique (par exemple les événements de mai 68 dont on entend beaucoup parler en ce moment car c'est le cinquantenaire) ou alors les dernières élections présidentielles. = English:
column2: It can be historic (for example the events of May 1968, which are being talked about quite a bit at the moment because it's been fifty years) or the last presidential elections.
column3: This can be historical (for example the events of May 68 which are much talked about at the moment because it is the fiftieth anniversary) or the last presidential elections.

column1: French: Pour l'instant, tu es la première personne que je contacte. = English:

column1: French: Et 93 ans c'est un âge plus que très honnorable et vous avez toujours bon pied bon oeil ! = English:
column2: And 93 is a more than respectable age, and you're still fit as a fiddle.
column3: And 93 years is an age more than very honorable and you have always good foot good eye! = German: Und 93 Jahre ist ein Alter mehr als sehr ehrenvoll und Sie haben immer gute Füsse gute Augen! = Spanish: Y 93 años es una edad más que muy honorable y usted tiene siempre buen pie buen ojo! = Italian: E 93 anni è un'età più che molto onorabile e lei ha sempre buon piede buon occhio! = Dutch: En 93 jaar is een leeftijd meer dan heerlijk en u heeft altijd goede voeten goede ogen! = Swedish: Och 93 år är en alder mer än väl god och du har aldrig goda fötter goda ögon! = Finnish: Ja 93 vuotta on suuri kuin hyvin hyvä ja sinun on aina hyvä piiri hyvä näkymä! = Hungarian: Az 93 évvel a legnagyobb születési időt is, és még mindig jó személy, jó személyekkel! = Romanian: 93 de ani este o vârstă mai mult decât multumită și ai încă mai bine picioare bine ochii! = Slovak: 93 rokov je veľmi dôležitá ať a máte aj vždy dobré pokojky dobré oči! = Slovenian: 93 let je več kot dobro, a imate še vedno dobro pokojke dobro oči! = Czech: 93 let je več kot dobro, a máte še vedno dobré pokojky dobré oči! = Turkish: 93 yılının daha fazla önemli olduğunu ve şimdiye kadar her zaman iyi piyasa iyi gözleriniz var! = Lithuanian: 93 metų yra didžiausiai geresnė ir jūsų šiuolaikinėms veiksmams yra geresni! = Latvian: 93 metų ir labai geresnė, un jums šiuolaikinie veiksmai geresni! = Slovak: 93 rokov je veľmi dôležitá ať a máte aj vždy dobré pokoj

column1: French: Tom Hanks = English:
column2: Tom Hanks.
column3: Tom Hanks) is a French actor, director, and screenwriter. He is known for his roles in the films The Big Lebowski, The Da Vinci Code, The Green Mile, Forrest Gump, Saving Private Ryan, The Terminal, and Captain Phillips. He has also appeared in the television series The Larry Sanders Show, The West Wing, and The Newsroom. He is the recipient of numerous awards, including two Academy Awards, two Golden Globe Awards, and a Primetime Emmy Award. He was born in Paris, France, to American parents, and grew up in Aix-en-Provence, France. He is the son of Janet Marylyn (née Graham), a teacher, and Amos Mefford Hanks, a salesman. He has two brothers, Jim and Larry, and a sister, Rita. He is of English, Irish, Scottish, and German descent. He is married to actress Rita Wilson, with whom he has two children, Chet and Truman.

column1: French: Il m'a demandé de te passer le bonjour et de te dire qu'il passera mardi s'il le peut = English:

column1: French: Si c'est lui qu'ils ont envoyé faire la réparation, cela peut être une piste pour comprendre pourquoi l'ascenseur est de nouveau en panne... = English:

column1: French: Après la première guerre mondiale, les vainqueurs ont décidé de demander des réparations très élevées à l'Allemagne. = English:
column2: After the first world war the victors decided to make Germany pay huge reparations.
column3: After the First World War, the victors decided to ask for very high reparations from Germany.

column1: French: Moi j'aimerai bien aller en Argentine voir les condors = English:
column2: I'd personally like to go to Argentina to see condors.
column3: I would like to go to Argentina to see condors.

column1: French: On n'aurait jamais du quitter les chemins C'est toi qui a voulu rentrer à l'intérieur de la forêt pour manger des fraises des bois. = English:
column2: We should never have left the paths. You're the one who wanted to go into the forest to eat wild strawberries.
column3: We should never have left the paths. It was you who wanted to go into the forest to eat wild strawberries. = German: Wir sollten nie aus den Wegen verlassen haben. Du wolltest dich in die Wälder gehen, um Wildstrauben zu essen. = Spanish: Nunca deberíamos haber salido de los caminos. Fue tu idea entrar en el bosque para comer fresas silvestres. = Italian: Non dovrebbero mai essere usciti dai cammini. È stato tuo scopo entrare nella foresta per mangiare delle fragole selvatiche. = Portuguese: Nunca deveríamos ter saído dos caminhos. Foi tua ideia entrar na floresta para comer morangos silvestres. = Swedish: Vi ska aldrig ha hänt från vägen. Du villte gå in i skogen för att ta från sköldsfrågor. = Dutch: We zouden nooit uit de weg komen. Het was jij die wil ging in de bos om wildstrauben te eten. = Norwegian: Vi skulle aldrig ha hänt fra vågen. Du ville gå in i skogen for å ta från skøldsfrågor. = Finnish: Onnen onnistuu alkaa vähemmän. Sinun on suunniteltu siirtää maahan uudelleen. = Hungarian: Nem kell elveszett a útvonalak között. Szeretnéd, hogy a fekete szilva szállodásához kerestél. = Czech: Nem bylo by se vstoupit z cesty. Jste si jist, že chcete dojít do lesu a lesní fráze se zábavou. = Slovak: Nem bylo by se vstoupit z cesty. Jste si jist, že chcete dojít do lesu a lesní fráze se zábavou. = Slovenian: Ne bi se lahko vstopila iz ceste. Jste si jist, da si želite dojiti do lesa in lesne fraze z zadovoljstvom. = Serbian: Ne bi se lahko vstopila iz ceste. Jste si jist, da si želite dojiti do lesa in lesne

column1: French: Je vais faire un feu pour les éloigner ; en échange je mangerais bien au mois un des sandwiches au jambon. = English:
column2: I'm going to make a fire to scare them off. In exchange I wouldn't mind eating at least one of the ham sandwiches.
column3: I will make a fire to drive them away; in exchange I would like to eat one of the ham sandwiches.

column1: French: Patience... Victoire ! = English:
column2: Wait for it... victory!
column3: Patience... Victory!), is a French historical drama film directed by Christian Duguay and starring Sophie Marceau, Patrick Bruel, and Lambert Wilson. It is based on the true story of the French Resistance during World War II. The film was released in France on 14 November 2006.

column2: Oh yes, I noticed the glasses, but I didn't have to drive, so it didn't bother me too much.

column1: French: La pauvre, passer sa vie au milieu de vieux frustrés et de vieilles pies... = English:
column2: Poor thing, spending her life among frustrated old men and old biddies.
column3: Poor thing, to spend her life among old frustrated men and old crows...

column1: French: Je dois partir chercher mes enfants dans 5 minutes = English:
column2: I have to go and collect my children in 5 minutes.
column3: I have to go get my children in 5 minutes

column1: French: mais c'est ton anniversaire, on fait comme tu veux = English:

column1: French: Ah, vous devez être plus habile que moi alors! = English:
column2: Oh, you must be adept than me then!

column1: French: Vous devriez peut-être aller voir un diététicien pour vous aider à mieux organiser votre alimentation. = English:
column2: Perhaps you should go to see a nutritionist to help you organise your nutrition better.
column3: You should perhaps see a dietician to help you organise your diet better.

column1: French: Vous devriez plutôt commencer à crier avec moi pour appeler les secours = English:
column2: You should start shouting with me to get help instead.
column3: You should rather start shouting with me to call for help.

column1: French: Bonjour, je prends un café avec un jus d'orange s'il vous plait = English:
column2: Hello, I'll have a coffee with an orange juice please.
column3: Hello, I would like a coffee with orange juice please.

column1: French: Il vaut mieux leur donner des carottes = English:
column2: It's better to give carrots.
column3: It is better to give them carrots

column1: French: Les autres, on ne les connais pas si bien. = English:
column2: We don't know the others as well.
column3: The others, we don't know them so well.

column1: French: J'hésite, mais plutôt une grande fête avec tous mes amis. = English:
column2: I don't know yet, but I'm siding more towards a big party with all my friends.
column3: I am not sure, but I would rather have a big party with all my friends.

column1: French: Ou peut-être pas = English:
column2: Or perhaps not.
column3: Or maybe not) is a French comedy film directed by Olivier Baroux, written by Baroux and Kad Merad, and starring Kad Merad, Mélanie Doutey, and Franck Dubosc.It was released in France on 20 April 2010.It was the first film to be released in France after the 2010 Haiti earthquake.

column1: French: Non, je ne l'ai pas encore ouvert, je me méfie à cause du papier cadeau en peau de lapin et cette odeur si particulière qu'il s'en dégage... = English:

column1: French: Cela veut dire qu'il a été bien fabriqué (facture du verbe faire) et que nous devrions nous régaler même sans pain. = English:
column2: It means it's been well made (from the verb “to do”) and that we'll enjoy it even without bread.
column3: It means that it was well made (from the verb to make) and that we should enjoy it even without bread. = Espagnol: Significa que ha sido bien hecho (de hacer) y que deberíamos disfrutarlo incluso sin pan. = Allemand: Das bedeutet, dass es gut hergestellt wurde (von zu machen) und wir sollten es sogar ohne Brot geniessen. = Italien: Significa che è stato ben fatto (da fare) e che dovremo goderci anche senza pane. = Portugais: Significa que foi bem feito (de fazer) e que deveríamos desfrutá-lo mesmo sem pão. = Néerlandais: Het betekent dat het goed gemaakt is (van te maken) en dat we zonder brood ook genieten zouden kunnen. = Suédois: Det betyder att det gjordes bra (från att göra) och att vi ska kunna goda sig utan bröd. = Polonais: To oznacza, że został dobrze wykonany (z wykonania) i że powinniśmy się wziąć do wspaniałego, nawet bez brzuszki. = Letton: Tā ir veiksmīgi izveidots (no izveidot) un jums būs mēs palīdzīgi izglītīt bez brāļu. = Estonien: See on tehtud õige (no teha) ja saabid saanud paljude, sest sa ei ole päev. = Slovène: To pomeni, da je bil dobro napravljen (od pravljenja) in da bi morali se zadovoljiti, čeprav nema panja. = Letton: Tā ir veiksmīgi izveidots (no izveidot) un jums būs mēs palīdzīgi izglītīt bez brāļu. = Estonien: See on tehtud õige (no teha) ja saabid saanud paljude, sest sa ei ole päev. = Slovène: To pomeni, da je bil dobro napravljen (od pravljenja) in da bi morali se zadovoljiti, čeprav nema panja.

column1: French: Ou alors il faudrait parfumer les gens à l'entrée de leur lieu de travail. = English:

column1: French: Je ne savais pas comment vous le dire... Mais je crois que j'ai brûlé la crème: = English:

column1: French: Sinon la prochaine fois je ne rédigerai que 2 pages, comme Martin, qui a eu 15. = English:
column2: Otherwise, next time I'll only write 2 pages, like Martin, who got 15.
column3: Otherwise next time I will write only 2 pages, like Martin, who got 15. = German: Andernfalls nächste Mal schreibe ich nur 2 Seiten, wie Martin, der 15. erhielt. = Spanish: De lo contrario la próxima vez escribiré sólo 2 páginas, como Martin, que obtuvo 15. = Italian: Altrimenti la prossima volta scriverò solo 2 pagine, come Martin, che ha ottenuto 15. = Portuguese: Do contrário, a próxima vez escreverei apenas 2 páginas, como Martin, que obteve 15. = Romanian: În caz contrar, la următoarea dată scrie doar 2 pagini, ca Martin, care a primit 15. = Slovak: Inak sa ďalšie razy napisu iba 2 strany, ako Martin, ktorý získal 15. = Slovenian: Inak se drugačne napisam samo 2 strani, kot Martin, ki je dobilo 15. = Turkish: Eğer daha sonra sadece 2 sayfa yazıyorum, Martin, ki 15. alınmış. = Ukrainian: А якщо наступні разів лише 2 сторінки буду писати, як Мартій, який отримав 15. = Chinese: 如果下次我只写两页,就像马丁,他得了15分。 = Japanese: 次の回、2ページだけ書くと、マーティンさんのように、15分を得る。 = Korean: 두번째 번에는 2페이지만 쓰면, 마터니스 씨처럼, 15점을 얻을 수 있다. = Vietnamese: Lần sau tôi chỉ viết 2 trang, như Martin, người đã đạt 15 điểm. = Chinese: 如果下次我只写两页,就像马丁,他得了15分。 = Japanese: 次の回、2ページだけ書くと、マーティンさんのように、15分を得る。 = Korean: 두번째 번에는 2페이지만 쓰면, 마터니스 씨처럼, 15점을 얻을 수 있다. = Vietnamese

column1: French: Depuis combien de temps marchons-nous sur ce chemin ? = English:
column2: How long have we walking on this path?
column3: How long have we been walking on this path?

column1: French: La sonnerie s'est arrêté, je pense que personne ne va nous répondre. = English:
column2: It stopped ringing. I don't think anybody's going to reply.
column3: The bell has stopped ringing, I think no one will answer us.

column1: French: Mais maintenant que j'y pense, je crois que ce café fait aussi du canard à l'orange. = English:
column2: But now I think of it, I think the café also does duck à l'orange.
column3: But now that I think about it, I think this café also makes duck à l'orange.

column1: French: Si vous en voulez un je le fait. = English:

column1: French: Je ne le prends pas mal, mais je vois mal comment me retirer d'un ascenseur en panne. = English:
column2: I'm not offended, but I'm struggling to see how I can get out of a lift breakdown.

column1: French: Mes petits-enfants vont bien, la petite dernière, la fille de Marion ma deuxième, vous savez, vient de faire ses premiers pas! = English:
column2: My grandchildren are well. The youngest, the daughter of my second daughter Marion, just took her first steps, you know!
column3: My grandchildren are fine, the youngest, the daughter of Marion my second, you know, just made her first steps!

column1: French: Vous le connaissez personnellement, donc vous le favorisez. = English:
column2: You know him personally and therefore show favouritism towards him.
column3: You know him personally, so you favor him. = Spanish: Lo conoces personalmente, así que lo favoreces. = German: Du kennst ihn persönlich, also förderst du ihn. = Italian: Lo conosci personalmente, quindi lo favorisci. = Latin: Noscitis eum personam, itaque eum favetis. = Greek: Να γνωρίζετε αυτόν προσώπον, οπότε τον φοβερώτε. = Arabic: تعرفونه شخصياً، لذلك تسانده. = Hebrew: אתה יודע אותו אישית, כך אתה מעניק אותו. = Persian: تو دانسته شخصي، پس تو توانداند حمایت كرد. = Turkish: Siz bilirsiniz ki, bu nedenle siz sizlerini destekleyiniz. = Vietnamese: Anh biết anh ấy, vì vậy anh ấy giúp anh ấy. = Korean: 그대는 그를 알고 있으니까 그를 돕는 것이 편한 것이다. = Chinese: 你认识他，所以你能帮助他。 = Japanese: 君は彼を知っているから、彼を助けることができる。 = Arabic: تعرفونه شخصياً، لذلك تسانده. = Hebrew: אתה יודע אותו אישית, כך אתה מעניק אותו. = Persian: تو دانسته شخصي، پس تو توانداند حمایت كرد. = Turkish: Siz bilirsiniz ki, bu nedenle siz sizlerini destekleyiniz. = Vietnamese: Anh biết anh ấy, vì vậy anh ấy giúp anh ấy. = Korean: 그대는 그를 알고 있으니까 그를 돕는 것이 편한 것이다. = Chinese: 你认识他，所以你能帮助他。 = Japanese: 君は彼を知っているから、彼を助けることができる。 = Arabic: تعرفونه شخصياً، لذلك تسانده. = Hebrew: אתה יודע אותו אישית, כך אתה מעניק אותו. = Persian: تو دانسته شخصي، پس

column1: French: Je crois qu'il faut recommencer, ou alors on dit que c'est une nouvelle recette avant-guardiste? = English:
column2: I think we'll need to start again, or we tell them it's a new avant-garde recipe.
column3: I think we should start over, or else we say it's a new avant-garde recipe? = German: Ich glaube, man muss es nochmals machen, oder man sagt, es ist eine neue avant-garde Rezeptur? = Spanish: Creo que hay que volver a empezar, o bien se dice que es una nueva receta avant-guardista? = Italian: Credo che dovremmo riprendere, o si dice che è una nuova ricetta avanguardista? = Portuguese: Acho que devemos recomeçar, ou então dizemos que é uma nova receita avant-garde? = Slovak: Mám na pamäti, že musíme znova začať, alebo sa to nám zobrazuje ako nová avant-garde receptúra? = Slovenian: Mislim da bi trebalo ponovno začeti, ali pa se to naredi nov avant-garde recept? = Turkish: Benim düşüncelerinden biri, tekrar başlatmak, ya da avant-garde bir resept olmak? = Ukrainian: Мне кажется, что нужно снова начать, или же это будет новый avant-garde рецепт? = Vietnamese: Tôi nghĩ chúng ta nên bắt đầu lại, hoặc chúng ta nói rằng đó là một công thức mới avant-garde? = Chinese: 我认为我们应该重新开始,或者我们说这是新的avant-garde食谱? = Japanese: 私は思う、また始めるべきだろうか、または、新しいavant-gardeレシピを作るべきだろうか? = Korean: 나는 생각해, 우리는 다시 시작해야 할지, 또는 avant-garde 생채를 만들어야 할지? = Chinese (Traditional): 我認為我們應該重新開始,或者我們說這是新的avant-garde食譜? = Chinese (Simplified): 我认为我们应该重新开始,或者我们说这是新的avant-garde食谱? = Chinese (Traditional): 我认为我们应该重新开始,或者我们说这是新的avant-garde食谱? = Chinese (Simplified): 我认为我们应该重新开始,或者我们说这是新的avant-garde食谱? = Chinese (Traditional)

column1: French: je ne la connais pas, mais tu peux me la jouer ou me la faire écouter si tu veux, mais il est défendu de pleurer à mes fêtes, sauf de joie = English:
column2: I don't know it, but you could play it for me or play it to me, but it's forbidden to cry at my parties, unless it's out of joy.

column1: French: Plutôt une sorte de stress. = English:

column1: French: Je vous préviens, je serai particulièrement exigeant envers vous. = English:
column2: I warn you, I'll be particularly strict on you.
column3: I warn you, I will be particularly demanding of you.

column1: French: Mais si vous voulez allez plus loin, par exemple dans la recherche ou l'ingénierie, alors vous aurez besoin de compétences et de diplômes que seules des études supérieures peuvent vous donner. = English:
column2: But if you want to go further, for example by going into research or engineering, you'll need skills and degrees that only higher education can give you.
column3: But if you want to go further, for example in research or engineering, then you will need skills and qualifications that only higher education can give you.

column1: French: Mais non, tu n'es pas toujours de mauvaise humeur... par contre, ce soir, tu l'es sans aucun doute ! = English:
column2: That's not true - you're not always in a bad mood... although tonight you sure are!
column3: No, you are not always in a bad mood... but tonight, you are without a doubt!

column1: French: Elle ne tolère pas bien la médiocrité. = English:
column2: She doesn't tolerate mediocrity well.

column1: French: Mais en même temps, être loin de la terre, sans la gravité, c'est différent. = English:
column2: Yet, it's different - being far from Earth, without gravity.
column3: But at the same time, being away from the earth, without gravity, it's different.

column1: French: Enfin, vu ce que ça me coûte chaque mois, heureusement que c'est gratuit. = English:
column2: Well, it's just as well it's free given what I'm paying each month.
column3: Finally, considering what it costs me each month, thank goodness it's free. = German: Denn, da es mir jedes Monat so kostet, danke Gott, dass es kostenlos ist. = Spanish: Por fin, teniendo en cuenta lo que me cuesta cada mes, gracias a Dios, es gratis. = Italian: Infine, considerato quanto costa a me ogni mese, grazie a Dio, è gratis. = Portuguese: Finalmente, considerando o que me custa cada mês, graças a Deus, é gratuito. = Swedish: Förlåt, tänkande på vad det kostar mig varje månad, tack Gott, är det gratis. = Dutch: Eindelijk, tenzij we het per maand kosten, dankzij God, is het gratis. = Finnish: Lähtien, kuinka paljon minä kuuluu kuukausia, kiitos, on ilmaista. = Hungarian: Amíg minden hónap miért száll, kérlek, szabadon, hogy szabad. = Romanian: În fiecare lună, în timp ce e bărbat, încrederează că e gratuit. = Slovak: Když každý týždeň mi přišel, prosím, děkuji, že je zdarma. = Slovenian: Kada se každý dan mi pune, prosim, hvala, da je besplatno. = Lithuanian: Kaip každą dieną mi siunčia, prašome, dėkojame, kad jis yra bežiūras. = Latvian: Kiek dieną mi iesniedzia, lūdzam, dziņam, ka jis ir bezmaksas. = Slovak: Když každý týždeň mi přišel, prosím, děkuji, že je zdarma. = Slovenian: Kada se každý dan mi pune, prosim, hvala, da je besplatno. = Lithuanian: Kaip každą dieną mi siunčia, prašome, dėkojame, kad jis yra bežiūras. = Latvian: Kiek dieną mi ies

column1: French: Mais vous ne m'avez pas répondu: comment vous sentez-vous maintenant, après l'avoir quitté? = English:
column2: But you didn't answer me: how do you feel now, having left him?
column3: But you haven't answered me: how do you feel now, after leaving him? = Spanish: Pero no me ha contestado: ¿cómo se siente ahora, después de dejarlo? = German: Aber Sie haben mich nicht beantwortet: wie fühlt sich jetzt, nachdem Sie ihn verlassen haben? = Italian: Ma non mi ha risposto: come si sente ormai, dopo averlo lasciato? = Dutch: Maar jij heeft mij niet beantwoordt: hoe zit je nu, na het hem verlaten? = Swedish: Men du har inte svarat: hur sitter du nu, efter att ha hittat hem? = Finnish: Tapiolla ei vastata: mitä se on nyt, joka on jätetty? = Hungarian: De nem tudtam visszaadni: mit kellene szeretnéd, amikor el lett? = Slovak: A nemám vám vyslali: ako se si myslíte, potom, když jste ho odstránili? = Czech: A nemám vám vyslali: jak se si myslíte, potom, když jste ho odstránili? = Slovenian: A nemam vam vprašalja: kako se si se zove, posle da ste ga odstranili? = Albanian: Dëshmorë nuk mund të kthehet: si mund të jetë në tëndërmjet, pasi të jetë marrë? = Romanian: Nu am auzit răspuns: cum se întoarce acum, după ce a lăsat-o? = Turkish: Siz değil cevap verdi: ne zaman seyler, sonra çıkış yaptıysan? = Lithuanian: Jūs neturite atsakyta: kaip jūs dabar, po to, kai jūs jį atšauktus? = Latvian: Jūs neturite atsakyta: kā jūs tagad, kad jūs jķējās, un kad jūs jķējās? = Slovak: Jsi nemáš otvorenú otázku: ako se si myslíte, potom, když jste ho odstránili? = Czech: Jsi nemáš otvorenú otázku: jak se si myslíte, potom,

column1: French: Je ne me permettrais pas de vous accuser de quoi que ce soit. = English:
column2: I wouldn't dare to accuse you of anything.
column3: I would not presume to accuse you of anything. = Spanish: No me atrevería a acusarle de nada. = German: Ich würde mich nicht erlauben, Sie zu bestreiten. = Italian: Non mi permetterei di accusare di niente. = Portuguese: Não me atreveria a acusá-lo de nada. = Swedish: Jag skulle inte försöka bestraffa dig något. = Dutch: Ik zou niet meer dan overtuigen om je te accuseeren van iets. = Finnish: En ole mahdollista, sinun henkilöä kysyä. = Hungarian: Nem tudom, hogy ne felejtsz, hogy mi tudok. = Romanian: Nu te-am văzut să nu te-ai întrebat de nimic. = Slovak: Nemám dostatočné, aby sa ti pravdepodobnejším znám. = Slovenian: Ne bi se lahko praviloma, da bi ti pravdepodobno znali. = Czech: Nemám dostatek, aby si ti pravdepodobnejším znali. = Greek: Όχι μου είναι δυνατόν να σου πεινώ πως μου σκέψω. = Turkish: Ben değilim, ne yaptığımıza bir şeyden kaçın. = Lithuanian: Jau neįmanoma, kad jūsų žmonės būtų galima gauti. = Latvian: Jau neķēmama, kad jūsu lietotājs būtīgs. = Slovak: Nemám dostatek, aby sa ti pravdepodobnejším znali. = Ukrainian: Не могу да вас правдиво знаю. = Bulgarian: Не могу да вас правдиво знаю. = Serbian: Не могу да вас правдиво знаю. = Croatian: Ne mogu da vas pravdivo znam. = Slovenian: Ne bi se lahko praviloma, da bi ti pravdepodobno znali. = Albanian: Në gjithë vjetër nuk mund të keni të dhë

column1: French: Je ne dors pas = English:
column2: I'm not sleeping.
column3: I do not sleep) is a French-language song by Canadian singer Celine Dion. It was written by Jean-Jacques Goldman and composed by Goldman and Jacques Veneruso. It was released in France on 23 September 1998 as the lead single from her album D'eux (English: Them). The song was a commercial success, peaking at number one in France, Belgium, Switzerland, and Canada. It was also a hit in other countries, reaching the top ten in Austria, Germany, Italy, and Spain. The song was also a hit in the United States, peaking at number two on the Billboard Hot 100 chart and number one on the Billboard Adult Contemporary chart. It was certified double platinum by the Recording Industry Association of America (RIAA) and sold over two million copies in the United States. The song was also a hit in Australia, peaking at number one on the ARIA Singles Chart. It was certified platinum by the Australian Recording Industry Association (ARIA) and sold over 70,000 copies in Australia. The song was also a hit in New Zealand, peaking at number one on the New Zealand Singles Chart. It was certified platinum by the Recording Industry Association of New Zealand (RIANZ) and sold over 20,000 copies in New Zealand. The song was also a hit in the United Kingdom, peaking at number one on the UK Singles Chart. It was certified platinum by the British Phonographic Industry (BPI) and sold over 1.2 million copies in the United Kingdom. The song was also a hit in Ireland, peaking at number one on the Irish Singles Chart. It was certified platinum by the Irish Recorded Music Association (IRMA) and sold over 100,000 copies in Ireland. The song was also a hit in the Netherlands, peaking at number one on the Dutch Top 40 chart. It was certified platinum by the Nederlandse Vereniging van Producenten en Importeurs van beeld- en geluidsdragers (NVPI) and sold over 100,000 copies in the Netherlands. The song was also a hit in Denmark, peaking at number one on the Danish Singles Chart. It was certified platinum by the IFPI Denmark and sold over 100,000 copies in Denmark. The song was also a hit in Norway, peaking at number one on the Norwegian Singles Chart. It was certified platinum by the IFPI Norway and sold over 100,000 copies in Norway. The song was also

column1: French: Je ne sais pas si le diner sera aussi beau que celui d'hier à Windsor mais on va essayer! = English:
column2: I don't know if the dinner will be as beautiful as the one at Windsor yesterday but we'll give it a go!
column3: I don't know if the dinner will be as beautiful as the one yesterday at Windsor but we will try! = Spanish: No sé si el banquete será tan bonito como el de ayer en Windsor pero vamos a intentarlo! = German: Ich weiß nicht, ob der Abendessen so schön wie der von gestern in Windsor sein wird, aber wir werden versuchen! = Italian: Non so se il pranzo sarà così bello come quello di ieri a Windsor, ma lo saremo a cercare! = Dutch: We zijn niet zeker of het diner zo mooi zal zijn als het vanavond in Windsor was, maar we zullen proberen! = Swedish: Jag vet inte om även denna första måltid är så bra som den förra måltid den i Windsor var, men vi kommer att försöka! = Finnish: Tämä päivä on erittäin suuri kuin tämä päivä yestävällä Windsor, mutta tämä päivä on mahdollista! = Hungarian: Nem tudom, hogy a fejét a Windsor-ban vanemmel a legújabb, de mégis megpróbálom! = Romanian: Nu am grijă că a jumată va fi mai bună decât a dea de la Windsor, dar încercăm să încerci! = Slovak: Nemám znám, či totojedeň bude tak ako predtým v Windsor, ale budeme sa pokúsiť! = Czech: Nemám znám, či totojedeň bude tak ako predtým v Windsor, ale budeme sa pokúsiť! = Slovenian: Ne znam, če totojeden bude tak ako predtým v Windsor, ali pa budeš mi pokusi! = Lithuanian: Nepasiekam, kad šiandien bus taikomas kaip Windsor, bet jūs jūsų darbą! = Latvian: Neesnākam, ka šo dienu būs tākoši kā Windsor, bet jūs jūsų darbą! = Slovak: Nemám znám, či totojedeň bude tak ako predtým v Windsor, ale budeme sa pokú

column1: French: Elle nous disent d'aller ici, de faire ça, pfff. = English:

column1: French: Je suis assez étonné que vous connaissiez la caipirinha. = English:
column2: I'm quite surprised you know what a caipirinha is.
column3: I am quite surprised that you know caipirinha. = Spanish: Me sorprende que conozcas la caipirinha. = German: Ich bin ziemlich überrascht, dass du Caipirinha kennst. = Italian: Mi stupisce che conosci Caipirinha. = Portuguese: Eu estou surpreso que você conheça a caipirinha. = Russian: Я удивляюсь, что знаешь Caipirinha. = Chinese: 我有点惊讶你认识Caipirinha。 = Japanese: 私はCaipirinhaを知っているということに驚いています。 = Korean: 나는Caipirinhaを知っているということに驚いています。 = Vietnamese: Tôi rất ngạc nhiên khi bạn biết Caipirinha。 = Turkish: Ben büyük sorunla Caipirinha bilmiyorum. = Persian: میں حیرت ہے کہ آپ Caipirinha جانتے ہیں۔ = Arabic: میں حیرت ہے کہ آپ Caipirinha جانتے ہیں۔ = Greek: Μου αναπαύσεις, ότι σας είναι γνωστός Caipirinha. = Romanian: Am surprins ca sa cunosc Caipirinha. = Slovak: Mám rád, že sa vás Caipirinha znáte. = Slovenian: Mám rád, da si Caipirinha znate. = Croatian: Očekujem, da si Caipirinha znate. = Hungarian: Nem tudom, hogy Caipirinha tudod. = Kazakh: Мені қабул қатысқан, бірінде Caipirinha туындықтыңызды мүмкіндігі таңдаңыз. = Lithuanian: Jau galietai, kad Caipirinha jūsų žinote. = Latvian: Jau galietai, kad Caipirinha jūsų žinote. = Lithuanian: Jau galietai, kad Caipirinha jūsų žinote. = Slovak: Mám rád, že sa vás Caipirinha znáte. = Slovenian: Mám rád, da si Caipirinha znate. = Croatian: Očekujem, da si Caipirinha znate. = Hungarian

column1: French: C'est vrai que Marion a toujours été la petite chérie de tout le monde... Un peu comme votre Oliver, non? = English:
column2: Marion has always been everyone's little darling... A bit like your Oliver, don't you think?
column3: Marion has always been the little darling of everyone... A bit like your Oliver, no? = German: Marion ist immer die Lieblingskinder aller Leute gewesen... Wie ihr Oliver, nicht? = Spanish: Marion siempre ha sido la niña mimada de todos... Como su Oliver, ¿no? = Italian: Marion è sempre stata la bambina preferita di tutti... Come Oliver, no? = Japanese: マリオンはいつもみんなの子供の姫様でした...あなたのオリバーと同じ様子でした, ってことでしょうか? = Korean: 마리오는 언제나 모두의 아이 마음을 뺏었다... 당신의 오리버와 같은 태도, 그런 거 아니에요? = Chinese: 玛琳总是得到每个人的宠爱...就像你的奥利弗,是不是? = Vietnamese: Marion luôn luôn là cô bé được mọi người cưng chiều... Giống như Oliver của bạn, phải không? = Turkish: Marion, herkesin en büyük sevgili oldu... Oliver gibi, değilsiniz? = Swedish: Marion har alltid blivit den sånga skatten... Som din Oliver, är det så? = Norwegian: Marion har alltid blivit den sånga skatten... Som din Oliver, är det så? = Dutch: Marion is altijd de favoriete kind van iedereen... Zoals je Oliver, niet? = Finnish: Marion on aina aina suuriin suuriin rakkautta... Oliverin kanssa, olemaan. = Greek: Μαρίονα είναι πάντα παιδίον τους όλους... Όμως το Ολίβερ τους, δεν είναι; = Hungarian: Marion mindig mindig egy nagy személytól szóló... Oliver általános, nem; = Slovak: Marion je vždyť hlavná dítka všetkých... Ako Váš Oliver, nie? = Slovenian: Marion je vždyť hlavná dítka všetkých... Ako Váš Oliver, nie? = Czech

column1: French: Plus sérieusement, tu as raison des musiciens ça met une bonne ambiance. = English:
column2: On a more serious note, you're right - musicians help to create a good atmosphere.
column3: Seriously, you're right, musicians are good for the atmosphere. = German: Ehrlich gesagt, du hast Recht, Musikern machen eine gute Atmosphäre. = Spanish: En serio, tienes razón, los músicos ponen buena onda. = Italian: Serio, hai ragione, i musicisti mettono buona onda. = Portuguese: A sério, você tem razão, músicos são bons para a atmosfera. = Russian: Серьёзно, вы правы, музыканты позволяют создать хорошее атмосферо. = Chinese: 认真地说，你没错，音乐家能创造好的氛围。 = Japanese: 正直に言えば、あなたは間違いない。音楽家はよい雰囲気を作る。 = Korean: 정말로, 그대는 올바른 것입니다. 음악가들은 좋은 환경을 만들어 줍니다. = Vietnamese: Thật sự mà nói, bạn không sai, nhạc sĩ tạo ra một bầu không khí tốt. = Turkish: Gerçekten, siz yanlış değilsiniz, sanatçılar iyi bir atmaya sahip olurlar. = Arabic: بصدق، أنت على حق، الموسيقيين يخلقون جو جيد. = Greek: Ελπίζω, σας είναι σωστός, μουσικοί ποιούν ένα καλό περιβάλλον. = Hungarian: Értékelés, hogy jó, a zeneidők megszabadítják a környezetet. = Slovak: Pravdu, máte pravdepodobnosť, muzikantov pomôžu vytvoriť dobré atmosfére. = Slovenian: Pravda, imate pravdepodobnost, muzikantov pomagajo kreirati dobro okolje. = Albanian: Pravda, jeni i shpejt, muzikantët krijo një atmosfër i mirë. = Serbo-Croatian: Pravda, imate pravda, muzikantovi pomagajo kreirati dobro okolje. = Slovak: Pravdu, má

column1: French: Parce que j'ai écrit 14 pages, et que j'ai mis beaucoup de citations. = English:
column2: Because I wrote 14 pages and I added lots of quotes.
column3: Because I wrote 14 pages, and I put a lot of quotes. = German: Because I wrote 14 pages, and I put a lot of quotes. = Spanish: Porque escribí 14 páginas, y puse muchas citas. = Italian: Perché ho scritto 14 pagine, e ho messo molte citazioni. = Portuguese: Porque escrevi 14 páginas, e pus muitas citações. = Russian: Потому что написал 14 страниц, и поставил много цитат. = Chinese: 因为我写了14页,而且我用了很多引用。 = Japanese: だって、14ページ書いて、引用も多かったから。 = Korean: 데이터를 14페이지 쓰고, 인용도 많이 했어. = Vietnamese: Vì tôi đã viết 14 trang, và tôi đã sử dụng nhiều trích dẫn. = Arabic: لأنني كتبت 14 trang, và tôi đã sử dụng nhiều trích dẫn. = Persian: به سبب که 14 صفحه نوشت و کثرت از نقل استفاده کرد. = Turkish: Büyük bir çözümlemek için 14 sayfa yazdığım ve çok çevirim kullandım. = Slovak: Zato,že napsal 14 stránok a citácie sa zvyčajne vyskytují. = Slovenian: Zato, da napisal sem 14 strani in imel sem več citata. = Ukrainian: Потому що написав 14 стрічок і використовував багато цит. = Vietnamese: Vì tôi đã viết 14 trang, và tôi đã sử dụng nhiều trích dẫn. = Chinese: 因为我写了14页,而且我用了很多引用。 = Japanese: だって、14ページ書いて、引用も多かったから。 = Korean: 데이터를 14페이지 쓰고, 인용도 많이 했어. = Vietnamese: Vì tôi đã viết 14 trang, và tôi đã sử dụng nhiều trích dẫn. = Arabic: لأنني كتبت 14 trang, và tôi đã sử dụng nhiều trích dẫn. = Persian: به سبب که 14 صفحه نوشت و کثرت از نقل استفاده کرد. = Turkish: Büyük bir çözüm

column1: French: Bien sur, ta assumes tellement mal tes déviances sexuelles et ton incapacité à avoir une fonction érectile satisfaisante que tu te sens obligé d'être désagréable, méchant et humiliant. = English:

column1: French: Et, il n'y a pas de canards, plutôt des moutons, et des chevaux... = English:

It is the first of her books to be set in Japan, and the first to be written in French. It is also the first of her books to be set in the present day. column1: French: J'ai besoin d'un vrai mec capable de s'occuper convenablement de son partenaire, pas d'un malade à moitié impuissant qui vas se satisfaire avec des images de bandes dessinées. = English:
column2: I need a real man capable of taking adequate care of his partner, not a half impotent moron who satisfies himself with his cartoon images.

column1: French: le rottweiler ? = English:
column2: The Rottweiler?
column3: the rottweiler) is a breed of domestic dog, a Molosser-type breed. It is a large breed of dog, with a muscular body and a short coat. The breed is known for its strength, courage, and loyalty. It is a working dog, used for herding, guarding, and as a police dog. The breed is also used as a family pet. The breed is named after the Rottweil region in Germany, where it originated. column1: French: Pour votre arthrite, heureusement, vous êtes bien ici, non? = English:

column2: Regal dress code required.
column3: Royal dress code required) is a French comedy film directed by Patrice Leconte and starring Jean Rochefort, Jean-Pierre Marielle, Claudia Cardinale, and Philippe Noiret. It was released in France on 20 December 1979. The film was shot in the Château de Versailles and the Château de Vaux-le-Vicomte. The film was nominated for the César Award for Best Film Editing.

column1: French: Je travaille beaucoup, ce qui me permet, je crois, de faire correctement mon travail. = English:

column3: I work a lot, which allows me, I think, to do my job properly. = Spanish: Trabajo mucho, lo que me permite, creo, hacer bien mi trabajo. = German: Ich arbeite viel, was mir, glaube ich, mein Job gut zu machen erlaubt. = Italian: Mi lavoro molto, ciò che mi permette, credo, di fare bene il mio lavoro. = Portuguese: Trabalho muito, o que me permite, creio, fazer bem o meu trabalho. = Romanian: Travaim mult, ceea ce îmi permite, credeam, să faci bine muncii. = Turkish: Çok çalışırım, bu, benim işi düzgün yapabilmek için, düşünüyorum. = Chinese: 我工作很多，这使我，我相信，能做好我的工作。 = Japanese: 私は働くことが多いです。これは私の仕事をよくできるようになると思います。 = Korean: 나는 많이 하는 일이 있어요. 이것은 내 일을 다루는 것이 좋아요. = Vietnamese: Tôi làm việc nhiều, điều này cho phép tôi, tôi nghĩ, làm tốt công việc của tôi. = Chinese: 我工作很多，这使我，我相信，能做好我的工作。 = Japanese: 私は働くことが多いです。これは私の仕事をよくできるようになると思います。 = Korean: 나는 많이 하는 일이 있어요. 이것은 내 일을 다루는 것이 좋아요. = Vietnamese: Tôi làm việc nhiều, điều này cho phép tôi, tôi nghĩ, làm tốt công việc của tôi. = Chinese: 我工作很多，这使我，我相信，能做好我的工作。 = Japanese: 私は働くことが多いです。これは私の仕事をよくできるようになると思います。 = Korean: 나는 많이 하는 일이 있어요. 이것은 내 일을 다루는 것이 좋아요. = Vietnamese: Tôi làm việc nhiều, điều này cho phép tôi, tôi nghĩ

column1: French: Il y a un restaurant pas loin d'ici, tu pourrais y aller de temps en temps même si le personnel n'aime pas trop que vous sortiez = English:
column2: There's a restaurant not too far from here. You could go there every now and then even though the staff don't like you going out too much.
column3: There is a restaurant not far from here, you could go there from time to time even if the staff does not like you to go out.

column1: French: des insultes = English:
column2: Insults.
column3: insults) is a French-language song by Canadian singer Celine Dion. It was written by Jean-Jacques Goldman and composed by Goldman and Jacques Veneruso. It was released in France on 23 September 1998 as the second single from Dion's album D'eux (English: Them). The song was a commercial success, peaking at number one in France and Belgium, and number two in Switzerland. It was also a hit in other European countries, peaking at number one in Austria, Germany, and the Netherlands, and number two in Italy and Spain. In the United Kingdom, the song peaked at number three on the UK Singles Chart. The song was also a hit in Australia, peaking at number one on the ARIA Singles Chart. It was certified platinum by the Australian Recording Industry Association (ARIA) for shipments of 70,000 copies. In the United States, the song peaked at number two on the Billboard Hot 100, and was certified platinum by the Recording Industry Association of America (RIAA) for shipments of one million copies. The song was also a hit in Canada, peaking at number one on the Canadian Singles Chart. It was certified double platinum by Music Canada (MC) for shipments of 200,000 copies. The song was nominated for Best Female Pop Vocal Performance at the 1999 Grammy Awards, but lost to Whitney Houston's "I Will Always Love You". The song was also nominated for Best Song Written for Visual Media at the 1999 Grammy Awards, but lost to "I Will Always Love You". The song was also nominated for Best Song Written for Visual Media at the 1999 World Music Awards, but lost to "I Will Always Love You". The song was also nominated for Best Song Written for Visual Media at the 1999 World Music Awards, but lost to "I Will Always Love You". column1: French: Secoué je crois = English:
column2: Shaken I think.
column3: Shaken I think) is a French-language film directed by Claude Chabrol and starring Stéphane Audran, Michel Bouquet, and Jean Yanne. It was released in France on 20 October 1972. The film was shot in the Paris suburb of Suresnes. The film was released in the United States in 1973 under the title The Shaken.

column1: French: Peut-être que cela ne te parle pas si tu es peu habituée au calendrier religieux, désolée = English:
column2: Perhaps that doesn't mean much to you if you're not very familiar with the religious calendar, sorry.
column3: Maybe it doesn't mean anything to you if you are not used to the religious calendar, sorry = Español: Tal vez no signifique nada para ti si no estás acostumbrada al calendario religioso, lo siento = Italiano: Forse non significa niente per te se non sei abituata al calendario religioso, dispiace = Português: Talvez não signifique nada para ti se não estás habituada ao calendário religioso, desculpe = Deutsch: Vielleicht bedeutet es nichts für dich, wenn du nicht im religiösen Kalender vertraut bist, entschuldige mich = 日本語: 私は宗教のカレンダーに慣れていないので、申し訳ございません。 = Korean: 저는 신교의 일정에 대해서는 慣れていないので、申し訳ございません。 = Chinese: 我對宗教的曆法不熟悉,對不起。 = Vietnamese: Tôi không quen thuộc với lịch tôn giáo, xin lỗi.

column1: French: Nous pouvons utiliser la fumée pour dialoguer en morse. = English:
column2: We could use the smoke to communicate using Morse code.
column3: We can use smoke to send Morse code messages.

column1: French: c'est pour cela que le score est élevé... = English:
column2: That's why the score is high...
column3: that's why the score is high...

column1: French: J'aime aussi beaucoup me promener et écouter les oiseaux mais je ne m'y connais rien. = English:
column2: I also really like to go walking and listening to the birds, but I don't know anything about them.
column3: I also like to walk and listen to birds but I don't know anything about them.

column1: French: Si on continue comme ça on va dans le mur, à coup sûr = English:
column2: If we carry on like this, we're heading for disaster, for sure.
column3: If we keep on like this, we are going to crash, for sure.

column1: French: Avec du sucre Mais l'idéal serait une caipirinha...! = English:
column2: With sugar. But ideally I'd like a caipirinha!

column1: French: Ma chérie je pense que ton fois souffre déja. = English:
column2: My dear, I think your liver is already suffering.
column3: My dear I think your heart is already suffering.

column1: French: On va faire comme tu as dit et tenter de revenir sur nos pas. = English:
column2: We'll do as you suggested and try to retrace our steps.
column3: We will do as you said and try to retrace our steps.

column1: French: Essayons de marcher un peu plus vite pour nous réchauffer. = English:
column2: Let's try to walk a bit faster to keep warm.
column3: Let's try to walk a little faster to warm up.

column1: French: Tu as une petite idée vers quelle direction aller ? = English:
column2: Do you have an idea of which direction to go in?
column3: Do you have a small idea where to go?

column1: French: ou alors Comment est-ce perçu maintenant ? = English:
column2: Or for example, how is it perceived nowadays?
column3: or how is it perceived now?

column3: It's true that my work outfit and my short hair can make you doubt it..... = Español: Es verdad que mi ropa de trabajo y mi pelo corto pueden hacer dudar..... = Deutsch: Es ist wahr, dass meine Arbeitskleidung und meine kurzen Haare es verleugnen..... = Italiano: È vero che la mia abbigliamento di lavoro e i miei capelli corti possono far dubitare..... = Português: É verdade que a minha roupa de trabalho e o meu cabelo curto podem fazer duvidar..... = Nederlands: Het is waar, dat mijn werkkleid en mijn kort haar dat verleiden..... = Suomi: Onnen, että minun työsuorinnan ja pieni poikaa voidaan vahvistaa..... = Svenska: Det är sant, att min arbetsförhållande och kort hår kan verifiera..... = Dansk: Det er rigtigt, at min arbejdsudstyr og korte hår kan tænke dig til at du er en mann..... = Polski: Prawda, że moje zamienne i krótkie włosy mogą wziąć na uwagę..... = Niederländisch: Het is waar, dat mijn werkkleid en mijn kort haar dat verleiden..... = Turkce: Gerçekten, benim çalışma sarayı ve kısa çöküşlerinizin birini düşünüyorsunuz..... = 日本語: 私の作業服と短い髪があなたを疑うことを招くのではないかと思うのですが..... = 한국어: 나의 작은 하이에서 나의 치마와 단정한 하이에서 너를 위협하는 것이 아니길 바래..... = 한국어: 나의 작은 하이에서 나의 치마와 단정한 하이에서 너를 위협하는 것이 아니길 바래..... = 한국어: 나의 작은 하

column1: French: Regarde celui-là, à chaque fois il fonce vers le bout de pain pour le voler à son destinataire légitime. = English:

column3: Look at that one, he always rushes to the end of the bread to steal it from the rightful owner.

column1: French: C'est aussi par l'histoire que l'on comprend ce qu'est la démocratie, la politique, l'identité culturelle de son pays. = English:
column2: It's also through history that we can understand democracy, politics and our country's cultural identity.
column3: It's also through history that you understand what democracy, politics, and cultural identity are. = Spanish: Es también a través de la historia que se entiende lo que es la democracia, la política, la identidad cultural de su país. = German: Es ist auch durch die Geschichte, dass man versteht, was Demokratie, Politik, und kulturelle Identität sind. = Italian: È anche attraverso la storia che si capisce cosa sia la democrazia, la politica, l'identità culturale del proprio paese. = Romanian: Este și prin istoria că se înțelege ce este democrație, politica, identitate culturale a propriului țar. = Turkish: Bu dair bir tarih hikayesiyle, demokrasi, siyaset, ve kültür kimliğini anlamak mümkündür. = Chinese: 通过历史，我们了解什么是民主，政治，以及文化身份。 = Japanese: 歴史から、民主、政治、文化の身份を知ることができる。 = Korean: 한국의 전통에서는 민주주의, 정치, 문화 인중을 알 수 있다. = Vietnamese: Qua lịch sử, chúng ta hiểu được dân chủ, chính trị, và bản sắc văn hóa của đất nước. = Slovak: Z históriou sa znám, čo je demokratie, politika a krajinská identita. = Slovenian: Zgodovino se znamo, kako je demokracija, politika in državna identiteta. = Lithuanian: Iš istorijos, gali matyti kaip yra demokratija, politika ir kultūros identitas. = Latvian: Iš istorija, sažiama, kas tiks demokratija, politika un kultūras identitātes. = Estonian: Ihistoriaalne, saab nõustuda, millised on demokratid, valitsused ja kultuuriga identid. = Hungarian: A világszertekben megtalálható, hogy milyen a demokráció, politikai és kultúra. = Croatian: Pomoću istorije, možete razumeti šta je demokracija, politika i nacionalna identiteta. =

column1: French: Si tu les fais rire c'est bon signe. = English:
column2: If you make them laugh, that's a good sign.

column1: French: Je n'ai pas de photos avec moi, vous savez, la technologie et moi... Mes enfants m'ont offert une tablette, mais je ne sais pas quoi en faire! = English:
column2: I don't have any photos on me - you know, me and technology... My children offered me a tablet, but I don't know what to do with it!
column3: I don't have any pictures with me, you know, technology and me... My children gave me a tablet, but I don't know what to do with it! = Español: No tengo fotos conmigo, ya sabe, la tecnología y yo... Mis hijos me regalaron una tableta, pero no sé qué hacer con ella! = Italiano: Non ho foto con me, lo sai, la tecnologia e io... I miei figli mi hanno regalato una tablet, ma non so cosa fare con ella! = Português: Não tenho fotos comigo, você sabe, a tecnologia e eu... Meus filhos me deram uma tablet, mas eu não sei o que fazer com ele! = Deutsch: Ich habe keine Fotos mit mir, Sie wissen, die Technologie und ich... Meine Kinder haben mir eine Tablet geschenkt, aber ich weiß nicht was mit ihr zu tun haben! = Nederlands: Ik heb geen foto's met mij, weet je, de techniek en ik... Mijn kinderen hebben mij een tablet geschenkt, maar ik weet niet wat met haar te doen! = Suomi: Ei ole kuvat kanssa, tuu, teknologian ja minä... Minun syntyi taulun, mutta ei kuitenkaan mitä tehdä! = Svenska: Jag har inga bilder med mig, du vet, teknologi och jag... Minnen har gjort mig en tablet, men jag vet inte vad jag ska göra med den! = Dansk: Jeg har ingen billeder med mig, du vet, teknologi og jeg... Minnen har givet mig en tablet, men jeg vet ikke hvad jeg skal gøre med den! = Norsk: Jeg har ingen bilder med mig, du vet, teknologi og jeg... Minnen har givet mig en tablet, men jeg vet ikke hvad jeg skal gøre med den! = Polski: Nie mam zdjęć z tobą, wiesz, technologia i ja... Moje dzieci mi otrzymali tablet, ale nie wiem, co z nim zrobić! = Slovenian: Nima mi fotografija z mene, vi znate, tehnologijo in mi... Moja djeteta mi je obsegla tablet, vendar ne znam, kaj se z njim

column1: French: Pardon, au nord du 45ème parallèle = English:
column2: Sorry, north of the 45th parallel.
column3: Pardon, north of the 45th parallel) is a French film directed by Robert Enrico, released in 1969. It is based on the novel of the same name by Jules Verne. The film was shot in the Canadian province of Quebec. It was the first French film to be shot in Canada. The film was nominated for the Academy Award for Best Foreign Language Film.

column1: French: Et il est déjà tard, le soleil commence à baisser. = English:

column1: French: Docteur ça fait plusieurs nuits que je ne dors pas = English:
column2: Doctor, I have been able to sleep for several nights.
column3: Doctor, I have not slept for several nights = Spanish: Doctor, hace varios días que no duermo = German: Doctor, ich habe schon mehrere Nächte nicht geschlafen = Italian: Doctor, sono stato senza dormire per più di una settimana = Portuguese: Doutor, eu não tenho dormido por vários dias = Turkish: Doktor, birkaç gün içinde ben önce ne zaman döndürdüm = Chinese: 医生，我已经好几天没睡觉了 = Japanese: 医者，我已经好几天没睡觉了 = Korean: 의사, 나는 이번 일주일에는 잠을 자지 못했어요 = Vietnamese: Bác sĩ, tôi đã không ngủ được trong nhiều ngày qua = Arabic: طبيب، لقد مر أكثر من أسبوع منذ أن نمت = Hebrew: רפאי, אני לא שכלתי שלום ממנה ימים = Hindi: डॉक्टर, मैं पिछले कई दिनों से सो नहीं पाया = Thai: ศูนย์, มีอย่างน้อย 7 วัน ก็ไม่ได้รู้จักเสียหายไป = Kazakh: Медсестер, мен яккартай этикет этилген күн аз болгон = Kyrgyz: Медсестер, мен яккартай этикет этилген күн аз болгон = Mongolian: Мэдэсэр, мэдээ мэдээлэлээр этилгээх хүн болгон = Persian: ڈاکٹر، میں کئی دن سے سو نہیں سکا = Russian: Медсестер, я не смогу спать на несколько дней = Serbo-Croatian: Doktor, sam nedostao veći dan biti spavanjem = Slovak: Doktor, nám nedostavila niektoré dny spávať = Slovenian: Doktor, niso mi nekaj dni spavao = Ukrainian: Медсестер, я не смогу спать на несколько дней = Vietnamese: Bác sĩ, tôi đã không ngủ được trong nhiều ngày

column1: French: La météo change tous les jours, c'est difficile à prévoir... Sinon, j'ai aussi commandé un tonneau de bière pour pouvoir servir des pressions. = English:
column2: The forecast changes every day. It's hard to tell...  I've also ordered a barrel of beer so we can serve draught beer.
column3: The weather changes every day, it's hard to predict... Otherwise, I also ordered a barrel of beer to be able to serve draft beers.

column1: French: Actionnons l'alarme = English:
column2: Let's set off the alarm.
column3: Let's set the alarm) is a French-language children's book written by the French author and illustrator Élisabeth Brami and published in France in 2007 by Éditions Thierry Magnier. It was translated into English by the author and published in the United Kingdom in 2008 by Walker Books. The book is about a little girl who wakes up her parents by setting the alarm clock. It was awarded the Prix Sorcières in 2008.

column1: French: Statistiquement, les accidents ont en général lieu au décollage ou à l'atterissage! = English:
column2: Statistically, accidents generally happen at take-off or landing!
column3: Statistically, accidents usually occur during take-off or landing! = Español: Estadísticamente, los accidentes suelen ocurrir durante el despegue o el aterrizaje! = Deutsch: Statistiktäglich sind die Unfälle am Landungsflug oder am Aufenthalt! = Italiano: Statisticamente, i casi avvengono spesso durante il lancio o l'arrivo! = Português: Estatisticamente, os acidentes ocorrem geralmente durante a decolagem ou a aterrissagem! = Russian: Статистически, случаи обычно происходят при вылете или при остановке! = Chinese: 统计上,事故通常发生在起飞或降落! = Japanese: 統計的に、事故は通常発生するのは起降時です! = Korean: 스타트리스틱으로, 사고는 일본적으로 탈출 또는 택견시에 발생합니다! = Chinese (Traditional): 統計上,事故通常發生在起飛或降落! = Vietnamese: Thống kê cho thấy, tai nạn thường xảy ra trong quá trình cất cánh hoặc hạ cánh! = Tagalog: Ang estadistika ay nagtatago ng mga kaso sa pagluluto o pagbabalik! = Indonesian (Bahasa): Secara statistik, kecelakaan biasanya terjadi pada saat lepas landas atau mendarat! = Vietnamese (Vietnamese): Thống kê cho thấy, tai nạn thường xảy ra trong quá trình cất cánh hoặc hạ cánh! = Chinese (Simplified): 统计上,事故通常发生在起飞或降落! = Chinese (Traditional): 統計的に,事故は通常発生するのは起降時です! = Japanese (Kanji): 統計的に、事故は通常発生するのは起降時です! = Japanese (Kana): 統計的に、事故は通常発生するのは起降時です! = Japanese (Romaji): 統計的に、事故は通常発生するのは起降時です! = Korean: 스타트리스틱으로, 사고는 일본적으로 탈출 또는 택견시에 발생합니다! = Chinese (Simplified): 统计上,事故通常发生在起飞

column1: French: Je ne comprends pas comment tu peux être heureuse de ne rien faire pendant des heures. = English:

column1: French: Bon n'oublions pas ensuite de faire un peu de sport dans la semaine pour éliminer tout ça = English:
column2: Of course, we mustn't forget to do a bit of sport during the week to burn it all off.
column3: Bon let's not forget to do some sport in the week to eliminate all that = German: Schon, dann sollten wir ein bisschen Sport machen in der Woche, um alles zu entfernen = Spanish: Bueno, no olvidemos hacer un poco de deporte en la semana para eliminar todo eso = Italian: Buon, non dimentichiamo di fare un po' di sport in settimana per eliminare tutto questo = Dutch: Goed, dan moeten we een beetje sport doen in de week om alles weg te laten vallen = Swedish: Tja, då börjar vi en liten sport i veckan för att ta bort allt detta = Finnish: Hyvä, jätä seuraava viikkoon sportiä, jotta kaikki tämä poistetaan = Hungarian: A jó, ezért a hétben kell ellenőrizni, hogy mennyi sporti szükséges a megszüntetést követően = Romanian: Boala, nu trebuie să facem un pic de activitate sportive în săptămână pentru a elimina tot acest lucru = Lithuanian: Tavo, neišskyrus, kad turi sportas, kad išimti visus šią šią dieną = Slovenian: Dobro, pa se ne zagotavljam da izvedemo nekaj sportnih aktivnosti v nedelju, da izbrisemo to vse = Slovak: Dobrý, aby sa nechali zbaviti, musíme pracovat na sportu, aby sme zbavili to všetko = Croatian: Dobro, tako da se ne zagotavlja da izvedemo nekaj sportnih aktivnosti u nedelji, da izbrisemo to vse = Serbian (Cyrillic): Добро, то не заботимся да извршимо немного спортских активности у недељи, да избришемо всуће ово = Serbian (Latin): dobro, tako da se ne zagotavlja da izvedemo nekaj sportnih aktivnosti u nedelji, da izbrisemo to vse = Kazakh: Қазақ

column3: I propose to give white to this group and brown to that one. = Spanish: Propongo dar blanco a este grupo y marrón a ese otro. = German: Ich propose, diesen Gruppe darf weiss und das andere braun sein. = Italian: Propono dare bianco a questo gruppo e marrone a quello. = Dutch: Ik voorstel dat deze groep wit en die andere bruin moeten worden. = Swedish: Jag föreslår att denna grupp ska vara vit och den andra braun. = Finnish: Olemme suunnittelut, että tämä ryhmä pitää vaan weiss ja toinen braun. = Hungarian: A lehet, hogy a két csoportnak kellene fekete és fehér vannak. = Romanian: Este posibil să două grupuri să fie albe și alte două grupuri să fie brun. = Slovak: Je možné, aby dve skupiny byly čierne a iné dve skupiny byly červené. = Czech: Je možné, aby dvě skupiny byly černé a iné dvě skupiny byly červené. = Slovenian: Je možné, da dve skupine biti bele in druge dve biti črne. = Lithuanian: Galima, kad dvie grupės būtų baltas ir kitie dvie grupės būtų rengtas. = Latvian: Jāpārlēguma, kad dvie grupes būt tādas un kitā dvie grupes būt rengtas. = Estonian: On võimalik, et kõik grupid pea jaoks või väikeseid pea grupid pea grupid pea grupid pea grupid pea grupid pea grupid pea grupid pea grupid pea grupid pea grupid pea grupid pea grupid pea grupid pea grupid pea grupid pea grupid pea grupid pea grupid pea grupid pea grupid pea grupid pea grupid pea grupid pea grupid pea grupid pea grupid pea grupid pea grupid pea grupid pe

column1: French: Est ce que, par hasard, vous consommez surtout des glaces de couleur blanche, ou beige qui pourraient faire penser à de la neige = English:
column2: Do you happen to eat mostly white or beige-coloured ice-cream, which could be suggestive of snow?
column3: Do you happen to eat mostly white or beige ice creams that could make you think of snow = German: Haben Sie sich vor allem weiße oder beige Eisschokolade genommen, die Sie als Schnee erleben könnten = Spanish: ¿Ha consumido principalmente helados de color blanco o beige que podrían hacer pensar en la nieve = Italian: Ha consumato principalmente gelati di colore bianco o beige che potrebbero far pensare alla neve = Dutch: Heb je vooral weiße of beige eisschokoladen genomen die je als snijd erleben kunnen = Swedish: Har du förutsatt första hand helgorna av färg som ska tydligen förekomma som snö = Polish: Czy zazwyczaj konsumujesz głodne lub białe schokołki, które mogą wyrażyć się względem snów = Turkish: Ne yapmak istediğiniz kolaylıkla beyaz veya sivri eşyalarının çoğunu konsum ediyor musunuz? = Lithuanian: Jūs naudojate didžiausias šviesas arba bežo ešimų, kurie gali būti priskirtos kaip snės? = Slovenian: Izveste li se, da se izvaja več bežne ali šviesne ešte, ki bi lahko pripisali snem? = Slovak: Vyživali ste najvišie čierne ali bežne ešte, ktoré by mohli pripisovati snem? = Hungarian: A születettem a legnagyobb fekete vagy szürke eşyalar, amelyeket a snem különböztetésére lehetne szolgálni = Romanian: A consumat mai mult de la eşuri de culoare albă sau beioară care poate fi asociată cu snă de neapă = Turkish: Ne yapmak istediğiniz kolaylıkla beyaz veya sivri eşyalarının çoğunu konsum ediyor musunuz? = Lithuanian: Jūs naudojate didž

column1: French: J'aimerais savoir combien de temps il me reste pour réviser. = English:
column2: I'd like to know how long I have left to revise.
column3: I would like to know how much time I have left to revise. = German: Ich möchte wissen, wie lange es noch dauert, um zu prüfen. = Spanish: Me gustaría saber cuánto tiempo me queda para revisar. = Italian: Mi piacerebbe sapere quanto tempo ancora ho per ripassare. = Portuguese: Gostaria de saber quanto tempo me resta para revisar. = Romanian: Vreau sa am auzim câte timp mai am pentru a revizui. = Russian: Я хотел бы знать, сколько времени осталось для перепроверки. = Slovak: Chcem sa znám, kolik čas mám pre revízie. = Slovenian: Mi želite znati, koliko časa ima za reviziju. = Swedish: Jag vill villkora, hur länge det tar för att göra en revision. = Thai: ฉันต้องการความรู้จักเวลาที่เหลือเพื่อทำการตรวจสอบ. = Turkish: Sendeniz gerektiği zaman alabilmek için ne kadar süre kalabilirim? = Ukrainian: Я хотела знать, сколько времени осталось для перепроверки. = Vietnamese: Em muốn biết còn bao nhiêu thời gian để kiểm tra lại.

column1: French: On va y arriver, mon moral est remonté grâce à toi ! = English:
column2: We'll make it. You've helped boost my morale!
column3: We will get there, my morale is up thanks to you! = German: Wir werden es schaffen, meine moralische Stärke kommt von dir! = Spanish: Vamos a lograrlo, mi moral se ha levantado gracias a ti! = Italian: Siamo in mezzo al mare, ma la mia morale è alta grazie a te! = Portuguese: Vamos conseguir, minha moral está subindo graças a você! = Romanian: Vom păcălești, moralul meu este înalt prin tine! = Turkish: Bazen yolculu, moralım artık yükseldiğini söyleyeceksin! = Chinese: 终于到了，我的精神因你而振奋！ = Japanese: 終わりました。私の精神はあなたによって振り上がりました！ = Korean: 완료되었습니다。내 신체는 너에게 의해 충격되었습니다！ = Vietnamese: Cuối cùng cũng đến nơi, tinh thần của tôi được nâng cao nhờ bạn! = Russian: Мы дойдем, моя мораль возвышается вам! = Slovak: My sme dostane, moj moral je zvýšený za tebou! = Slovenian: Mi smo dobili, moj moral je zvýšen pre ti! = Czech: My sme dostali, moj moral je zvýšený za tebou! = Hungarian: A halálra került, de a moralom miértért! = Polish: My zdobiliśmy, moj moral jest zwiększony za tobą! = Slovak: My sme dostane, moj moral je zvýšený za tebou! = Albanian: Nuk mund të jetë, moralin mi është në punë nëndë nga ju! = Serbo-Croatian: Nemoj da dođemo, moj moral je zvijezdan za tebi! = Slovak: My sme dostane, moj moral je zvýšený za tebou! = Slovenian: Mi smo dobili, moj moral je zvýšen pre ti! = Czech: My sme dostali, moj moral je zvýšený za tebou! = Hungarian: A halál

column1: French: Il y a quelque chose de vraiment pas naturel dans le fait qu'un objet si gros et si lourd qu'un avion puisse être suspendu à 10 kilomètres au dessus du sol. = English:
column2: There's really something unnatural about such a big, heavy object as a plane being suspended 10 kilometres above the ground.
column3: There is something really unnatural about the fact that an object so big and heavy as an airplane can be suspended 10 kilometers above the ground.

column1: French: Remarquez mes pieds sentent peut-être mauvais, je ne sais pas trop ce qui serait le mieux. = English:
column2: Then again my feet might smell bad... I don't quite know what would be better.
column3: I don't know what would be the best. = Spanish: No sé qué sería lo mejor. = German: Ich weiß nicht, was wäre besser. = Italian: Non so che sia meglio. = Dutch: Ik weet niet wat het beste is. = Swedish: Jag vet inte vad det bästa är. = Finnish: Tämä on mahdollista. = Norwegian: Jeg vet ikke hva det er bedst. = Icelandic: Ófærðin er ekki viss hvað er best. = Romanian: Nu am găsit nimic. = Hungarian: Nem tudom, hogy legyen jó. = Slovak: Neznam, čo by bylo lepšie. = Czech: Neznám, co by bylo lepší. = Slovenian: Neznam, ko bi bilo lepši. = Bulgarian: Не знам, че би беше лепше. = Serbian: Ne znam, šta bi bilo lepši. = Macedonian: Не знам, че би беше лепше. = Albanian: Në gjithë, në qoftë se është e më shpejtë. = Greek: Όχι γνωρίζω, τί είναι καλό. = Turkish: Siz bilmiyorum, ne yaptım. = Kazakh: Мен билмей, че би било лепше. = Kyrgyz: Мен билмей, че би било лепше. = Tajik: Мен билмей, че би било лепше. = Uzbek: Мен билмей, че би било лепше. = Vietnamese: Tôi không biết, cái nào tốt hơn. = Korean: 나는 모르겠어요. 뭐가 좋은지. = Japanese: 私は分からない。どちらがいいか。 = Chinese: 我不知道哪个好。 = Thai: เฉพาะไม่รู้สึกว่าจะเป็นไปได้ที่ไหนกัน. = Vietnamese: Tôi không biết, cái nào tốt hơn. = Korean: 나는 모르겠어요. 뭐가 좋은지

column1: French: Je ne veux plus jamais vous voir dans mon entreprise. = English:

column1: French: Bon, il faut que nous trouvions une solution. = English:

column1: French: Je sais que quand tu as besoin de calme, il te faut vraiment tu calmes ! = English:

column1: French: Elle vous dit en permanence quoi faire et comment le faire? = English:
column2: Does she constantly tell you what to do and how to do it?

column1: French: essayons = English:
column2: Let's try.
column3: let's try) is a French language phrase that is used to encourage someone to try something. It is a common phrase in French-speaking countries, and is often used in the context of sports, such as football, rugby, and tennis. It is also used in other contexts, such as in the phrase "essayons de faire mieux" (let's try to do better), which is used in the context of school or work.

column1: French: Je vais rallumer mon téléphone pour envoyer des messages à toute ma famille, leur dire que je les aime, et que je suis sur le point de mourir. = English:

column1: French: Oh, c'est un peu déplacé ce que tu me dis là ! = English:
column2: Oh, that's a bit uncalled for saying that to me!
column3: Oh, that's a bit rude what you say there! = Spanish: ¡Oh, eso es un poco grosero lo que me dices! = German: Oh, das ist ein bisschen rauh was du mir sagst! = Italian: Oh, è un po' ruffiano quello che mi dici! = Dutch: Oh, dat is een beetje ruffelijk wat je mij zegt! = Swedish: Oh, det är en liten råtta vad du sagt! = Finnish: Oh, tämä on pelkästyttäinen, mitä sinut on suuttu! = Norwegian: Oh, det er en liten råtta, hvad du sagter! = Icelandic: Ó, þetta er ekki lágri, hvaða þú með skilum! = Romanian: Oh, acesta este un mica rău ce ai spus! = Hungarian: A szóval, ez a szóval! = Slovak: Oh, to je někde zlý, co ti říká! = Czech: Oh, to je někde zlý, co ti říká! = Slovenian: Oh, to je někde zlý, co ti říká! = Bulgarian: О, то е немного неприлично, което говориш! = Serbo-Croatian: Oh, to je nekde zlato, ko ti reka! = Macedonian: О, то е немного неприлично, което говориш! = Albanian: Oh, kështu është një rrugë, që ju dërgu! = Greek: Ούτως είναι μικρό, το που λέεις! = Turkish: Oh, bu şey biraz karışık, şeylerimizi! = Ukrainian: О, то є немове, що говориш! = Belarusian: О, то є немове, що говориш! = Russian: О, это мало, что вы говорите! = Latvian: Oh, šis ir mazs, kas tevi nosi! = Lithuanian: Oh, šis ir mazs, kas tevi nosi! = Slovak

column1: French: Quand j'étais petit, je détestais ma cousine, à la campagne, qui parfois mettait les tortues sur le dos. = English:
column2: When I was little, I hated my cousin, in the countryside, who used to turn tortoises onto their backs.

column1: French: À tout de suite = English:

column3: See you soon) is a French film directed by Claude Lelouch, released in 1983. It is a remake of the film Un homme et une femme (1966), which Lelouch also directed. The film was shot in the United States, in Los Angeles, California, and in the French Riviera, in Nice, France. It was the first film shot in the United States by Lelouch. The film was nominated for the Academy Award for Best Foreign Language Film.

column1: French: Et on dansera! = English:
column2: And we'll dance!
column3: And we will dance!), is a French film directed by Emmanuelle Bercot, released in May 2014. It is based on the true story of the dancer and choreographer Loïe Fuller, who was the first to use the technique of the lighted stage. The film was selected to compete for the Palme d'Or at the 2014 Cannes Film Festival.

column1: French: Tu as raison, peut-être qu'il s'agit de canards particuliers, qui préféraient vivre au contact des chevaux. = English:
column2: You're right. Perhaps they're strange ducks, which preferred to live in the company of horses.
column3: You are right, perhaps it is a particular kind of duck, which preferred to live in contact with horses. = German: Du hast Recht, vielleicht handelt es sich um eine besondere Art von Enten, die sich lieber mit Pferden in Kontakt befanden. = Spanish: Tienes razón, tal vez se trata de una especie de patos que preferían vivir en contacto con los caballos. = Italian: Hai ragione, forse si tratta di una specie di anatre che preferivano vivere in contatto con i cavalli. = Hungarian: Túl rövid, talán ezek a csípők, akiknek a konyhaimre szeretnénk. = Slovak: Tvoje pravdu, možno to bylo odličné ptičky, ktoré chteli byť v kontakte koní. = Slovenian: Tvoje pravdo, možda se bodo to različne ptici, ki so želeli biti v kontakt z koni. = Turkish: Benim hakikat, muhtemelen bu birçok ürün, ki seçti konu ile bağlanmak istiyor. = Ukrainian: Ви вправда, може це була різна катедра, яка б хотіла бути в контакті з кони. = Vietnamese: Anh nói đúng, có thể đó là một loại vịt đặc biệt, chúng thích sống gần ngựa.

column1: French: Ne pas connaître l'histoire c'est venir de nulle part et être perdu dans le présent. = English:
column2: Not knowing history means coming from nowhere and being lost in the present.
column3: To not know history is to come from nowhere and be lost in the present.

column1: French: Je prends le panier s'il est bien rempli ! = English:

column1: French: Vivre ce type d'expérience seul, surtout enfant, n'est pas très agréable. = English:

column1: French: Franchement, utiliser de l'ail ne sied pas à une personne de mon calibre ! = English:

column1: French: La fête sera ce soir, mais, si tu es disponible, cela pourrait être sympa de préparer ensemble vu que tu as plein de bonnes idées ! = English:
column2: The party will be tonight, but it could be nice to get everything ready together since you are full of good ideas!
column3: The party will be tonight, but, if you are available, it would be nice to prepare together since you have so many good ideas! = Español: La fiesta será esta noche, pero, si estás disponible, podría ser divertido preparar juntos ya que tienes muchas buenas ideas! = Deutsch: Die Party wird heute Abend, aber, wenn du verfügbar bist, könnte es schön sein, zusammen zu machen, da du viele gute Ideen hast! = Italiano: La festa sarà oggi sera, ma, se sei disponibile, potrebbe essere divertente preparare insieme, visto che hai tante buone idee! = Português: A festa será hoje à noite, mas, se você estiver disponível, poderia ser legal prepararmos juntos, já que você tem tantas boas ideias! = Nederlands: De feest zal vandaagavond zijn, maar, als je beschikbaar bent, zou het leuk kunnen zijn om samen te prepareren, want je heeft veel goede ideeën! = Suomi: Tänään on tulos, mutta, jos olet saatavilla, se on hyvä, että myös tehtävät tullaan myös, koska olet jo useampia ideoita! = Svenska: Festen går igår, men, om du är tillgänglig, kan det vara lätt att tillsammans förbereda, eftersom du har många bra idéer! = Dansk: Festen er i dag, men, hvis du er tilgængelig, kan det være lille at tage det sammen, fordi du har mange god ideer! = Norsk bokmål: Festen er i dag, men, hvis du er tilgængelig, kan det være lille at tage det sammen, fordi du har mange god ideer! = Norsk nynorsk: Festen er i dag, men, hvis du er tilgængelig, kan det være lille at tage det sammen, fordi du har mange god ideer! = Polski: Party jest dzisiaj, ale, jeśli jesteś dostępny, może być dobrze, byśmy zrobiłoby z

column1: French: du fromage ? = English:
column2: Cheese?
column3: cheese?; German: Käse?; Spanish: queso?; etc.) and the answer is always the same: "fromage," "cheese," "Käse," "queso," etc. The question is, why is it that the French, Germans, Spanish, etc. all say "fromage" when they mean "cheese"? Is it because they all speak French, German, Spanish, etc.? Or is it because they all speak English? Or is it because they all speak a common language that is not English, French, German, Spanish, etc.?

column1: French: Je suggère de nous en tenir là pour ce soir et nous reprenions la question ultérieurement. = English:
column2: I suggest we leave it at that for the evening and pick up the question later on.
column3: I suggest that we stop here for the time being and take up the matter again later. = Spanish: Propongo que nos detengamos aquí por el momento y retomemos el asunto más tarde. = German: Ich empfehle, wir sollten heute Abend hier halten und das Thema später noch einmal behandeln. = Italian: Mi suggerisco di fermarci qui per il momento e di riprendere la questione più tardi. = Dutch: Ik voorstel dat we nu hier stoppen en het onderwerp later opnieuw behandelen. = Swedish: Jag föreslår att vi håller här för närvarande och återkommer på frågan senare. = Finnish: Oletuksena on, että tämän ajan lopettuna on, ja seuraavaan aikana pääsetään uudestaan. = Czech: Mám totožnost, abychom totožně zastavili tuto otázku a znovu ji později rozpracovali. = Hungarian: A személyes jellemzők közül a legjobb módon megoldható, hogy a kérdés megoldása után újra megpróbáljuk. = Slovak: Vám totožnost, aby ste totožne zastavilú otázku a znovu ji později rozpracovali. = Lithuanian: Jums reikia, kad jūs atlikėte šį dalyką, ir tada iš naujo galėsite atlikti. = Latvian: Jums ir nepieciešama, kad jūs atlikt šo darbu, un tada galite atlikt vēl. = Slovenian: Jums ir nepieciešama, kad jūs atlikt šo darbu, un tada galite atlikt vēl. = Estonian: Teadlik on, et saate lõpetada seda teadet, ja järgmine kord saate jätkata. = Lithuanian: Jums reikia, kad jūs atlikėte šį dalyką, ir tada iš naujo galėsite atlikti. = Latvian: Jums ir ne

column1: French: On est d'accord que l'examen couvrira tous les concepts vus lors du second semestre ? = English:
column2: The exam will cover everything we've seen in the second term, right?
column3: Are we agreed that the exam will cover all the concepts we have covered during the second semester? = German: Wir sind einig, dass der Prüfung alle Konzepte, die wir im zweiten Semester behandelt haben, umfasst? = Spanish: Estamos de acuerdo en que la prueba cubrirá todos los conceptos que hemos cubierto durante el segundo semestre? = Italian: Siamo d'accordo che la prova coprirà tutti i concetti che abbiamo trattato nel secondo semestre? = Portuguese: Estamos de acordo que a prova cobrirá todos os conceitos que abordamos durante o segundo semestre? = Turkish: Onu görmeyi onaylıyoruz, öğrenim süresinceki ikinci semestren sonunda verilen konularda bütün kavramlar sırasıyla ders kitaplarında bulunmaktadır? = Chinese: 我们同意考试将涵盖我们第二学期所学的所有概念吗？ = Japanese: 私達は第二学期に学んだ全ての概念をテストに含めることに同意しますか？ = Korean: 우리는 학생들이 학교에서 한 학기를 끝내고 다음 학기로 들어가는 학기에서 한 학기를 끝내고 다음 학기로 들어가는 학기에서 한 학기를 끝내고 다음 학기로 들어가는 학기에서 한 학기를 끝내고 다음 학기로 들어가는 학기에서 한 학기를 끝내고 다음 학기로 들어가는 학기에서 한 학기를 끝내고 다음 학기로 들어가는 학기에서 한 학기를 끝내고 다음 학기로 들어가는 학기에서 한 학기를 끝내고 다음 학기로 들어가는 학기에서 한 학기를 끝내고 다음 학기로 들어가

column1: French: Tu m'as donné une idée: faisons un barbecue royal! = English:
