column3: I am preparing a magic potion, but I won't tell you for what purpose! = German: Ich bereite eine magische Potion vor, aber ich sage nicht, für was sie! = Spanish: Estoy preparando una poción mágica, pero no voy a decir para qué! = Italian: Io preparo una pócima magica, ma non dirò perché! = Japanese: 私は魔法のポーションを作っていますが、何のために作っているのかは、おしえてくれません！ = Chinese: 我正在制作魔法药水,但我不告诉你为什麽! = Korean: 나는 마법의 포장을 만들고 있지만, 내가 만들어야 할 이유를 알려주지 않습니다! = Vietnamese: Tôi đang chuẩn bị một loại thuốc ma thuật, nhưng tôi sẽ không nói cho bạn biết tôi đang làm gì! = Turkish: Bazen bir sihirli potasyonu hazırlamak, ama ne yaptığım ne yaptığım için ne yaptığım! = Polish: Przygotuję początek magiczny, ale nie mówię, dlaczego! = Slovak: Prepravujem mágický počatok, ale nevidím, čo ho! = Slovenian: Pripravim magicku pocit, ali ne razumem, za čo! = Czech: Pripravuji mágický pocit, ale nevidím, proč! = Hungarian: Magyarul szereztem egy magiát, de nem tudom, hogy mi szereztem! = Romanian: Preparez un poțiune magică, dar nu voi spun ce! = Turkish: Bazen bir sihirli potasyonu hazırlamak, ama ne yaptığım ne yaptığım için ne yaptığım! = Ukrainian: Я праправую магический покет, а не говорю, зачем! = Serbo-Croatian: Pripravim magicku pocit, ali ne razumem, za čo! = Slovak: Prepravujem mágický počatok, ale nevidím, čo ho! = Slovenian: Pripravim magicku

column1: French: ah oui, super = English:
column2: Ah yes, great.
column3: yes, great) and the other one is a negative one (French: non, pas terrible = English: no, not great). The two sentences are presented in a random order. The participants are asked to judge the acceptability of the sentences on a scale from 1 (very bad) to 7 (very good). The mean score for the two sentences is calculated. The higher the score, the better the acceptability of the sentence. The mean score for the French native speakers is 5.8 (SD = 0.8) and for the English native speakers is 5.6 (SD = 1.1). The difference is not significant (t(30) = 1.2, p = 0.24).

column1: French: Puis un plat avec de la viande, et enfin un dessert avec des fruits rouges. = English:
column2: Then a meat main course and finally a dessert with red berries.
column3: Then a meat dish, and finally a dessert with red fruits. = Spanish: Luego un plato con carne, y finalmente un postre con frutos rojos. = German: Danach ein Fleischgericht, und schliesslich ein Dessert mit roten Obstern. = Italian: Poi un pranzo con carne, e infine un dolce con frutta rossa. = Dutch: Daarna een met vlees, en eindelijk een dessert met rooie fruit. = Swedish: Nästa en plats med fisk, och slutligen en dessert med röda frukt. = Finnish: Seuraava ja metsässä, ja lopullinen desserttiin röövien. = Norwegian: Næste og fisk, og slutligen dessert med rødfrukt. = Polish: Następny i z miąsa, a następnie dessert z rόżowych. = Czech: Další a svíčková, a konec dessert s růžovými. = Slovak: Ďalšie a svíčková, a konec dessert s růžovými. = Hungarian: Később egy gyűrűséges, és utána dessert s rózsaim. = Romanian: Următorul un plat cu carne, şi în final un dessert cu fructe rosii. = Lithuanian: Kitas ir gyvūnų, ir paskutinis dessertas su rūžų. = Slovenian: Naredi prst, a potom dessert z ržav. = Ukrainian: Після площа, і завершення десерти з розами. = Bulgarian: По-наступно площ, і завісно десерт з розами. = Serbo-Croatian: Posle plošča, i završenje desserta z rožama. = Slovak: Po následujúcich plochách a konci dessertu s ržavou. = Czech: Po následujúcich plochách a konci dessertu s růžovými. = Slovenian: Po následujúcich plochách a konci dessertu s ržav

column2: I hope you got to go to Mach Picchu anyhow.
column3: I hope you were able to go to Machu Picchu.

column1: French: J'ignore totalement à quel étage si trouve votre bureau, vous savez. = English:
column2: I have no idea which floor your office is on, you know.
column3: I have no idea where your office is located, you know. = Spanish: No tengo ni idea de en qué piso está su oficina, sabe. = German: Ich weiß gar nicht, in welchem Stock ist Ihre Büro, weißt du. = Italian: Non so proprio a quale piano si trova la sua ufficio, sa. = Dutch: Ik weet niet waar je werk is, weet je. = Swedish: Jag vet inte varför du arbetar, vet du. = Finnish: Tuntematon, kuinka monta tavoin on sinä työpaikka, tahtoisin. = Norwegian: Jeg vet ikke hvor din arbeidsstue er, vet du. = Czech: Nemám nikde, kde je vaše pracovní místo, znáš. = Slovak: Nemám nikde, kde je vaša pracovná místo, znáš. = Hungarian: Nem tudom, hogy milyen szinten van a személyi munkahelye, tudod. = Romanian: Nu am nevoie de unde este locul tău de muncă, înţelege. = Slovenian: Nimam nikajo, kje je vaša radna mesta, znate. = Bulgarian: Не знам, где най-вероятно е ваша работа, знаеш. = Serbo-Croatian: Ne znam, gde je vaša radna mesta, znate. = Lithuanian: Neprašome, ką yra jūsų darbo vieta, jūsų. = Latvian: Neatpazīmē, kur ir jūsu darba vieta, jūs. = Slovak: Neprašujeme, kde je vaša radna mesta, jūs. = Estonian: Teadmata, kuidas on sinu töölaika, tead. = Lithuanian: Neprašome, ką yra jūsų darbo vieta, jūsų. = Latvian: Neatpazīmē, kur ir jūsu darba vieta, jūs. = Slovak: Neprašujeme, kde je vaša radna mesta, jūs. = Estonian: Teadmata, kuidas on sinu töölaika, tead.

column1: French: Mais je trouve que les secours sont bien longs à se manifester. = English:

column1: French: Je pense que vous devriez, en temps que patron, faire quelque chose pour que ces pannes cessent ! = English:

column1: French: Mais tout va bien, je refais le dessert, et je vous promets que je serai à l'heure et que je vais faire attention! = English:

column1: French: Je vous conseille donc : une pratique sportive CALME régulière (exemple, le footing), verrouiller votre four et manger des repas froids pour éviter un sinistre dans votre immeuble, et vous mettre au théâtre. = English:
column2: I therefore advise you to: do a regular CALM sporting activity (jogging for example), lock your oven and eat cold meals to avoid an accident in your building, and to start acting.

column1: French: C'est stupide, c'est trop gras et trop salé. = English:
column2: That's stupid - they're too fatty and too salty.
column3: It's stupid, it's too fat and too salty. = Spanish: Es estúpido, es demasiado graso y salado. = German: Das ist dumm, es ist zu fett und zu salzig. = Italian: È stupido, è troppo grasso e troppo salato. = Dutch: Het is stukken, het is te veel zout en zuur. = Swedish: Det är dåligt, det är för fett och för salat. = Finnish: Se on tullut, se on liian suuri ja liian salattu. = Norwegian: Det er dårlig, det er for meget fett og for meget salat. = Icelandic: Þetta er dælig, þetta er for meget fett og for meget salat. = Romanian: Aceasta este foarte grea, este foarte grassa si foarte sale. = Hungarian: Ez a személyes, ez a túl nagy és túl salát. = Greek: Αυτό είναι μακρύ, είναι πολύ σάλτης και πολύ σουρές. = Turkish: Bu şey daha çok salata ve daha çok suu. = Slovak: To je študné, je veľmi suho a veľmi salát. = Czech: To je študné, je veľmi suho a veľmi salát. = Slovenian: To je študno, je veľmi suho in veľmi salato. = Serbian: To je študno, je veľmi suho in veľmi salato. = Lithuanian: Šis yra študnas, yra didelė suja ir didelė salata. = Latvian: Šis ir študnas, ir lielas sujas un lielas salatas. = Bulgarian: То е грешен, е прекалено големи и прекалено солидни. = Macedonian: Ово је грешка, је прекалено голема и прекалено солидна. = Albanian: Kjo është e gjithmonë e gabuar, e shumë e madhe dhe e shumë e salit

column3: Attention, there are roots everywhere, we don't want to hurt ourselves! = German: Achtung, es gibt Wurzeln überall, wir wollen uns nicht noch verletzen! = Spanish: Atención, hay raíces por todas partes, no queremos hacernos daño! = Italian: Attenzione, ci sono radici per tutto, non vogliamo farsi male! = Portuguese: Atenção, há raízes por todo o lado, não queremos magoar-nos! = Russian: Обратите внимание, есть корни везде, не хотим уже взбиться! = Chinese: 注意,到处都是根,我们不要伤害自己! = Japanese: 注意,根はすべてのある,私たちは自分を傷つけないでください! = Korean: 주의, 더러운 생명의 생명이 있다. 우리는 자신을 상처를 하지 않도록 하십시오! = Vietnamese: Chú ý, có rễ ở khắp mọi nơi, chúng ta không muốn làm tổn thương chính mình! = Turkish: Düşünceler, her şeydeki kökler var, birini kendilerini bozmak istemiyoruz! = Arabic: انتباه, هناك جذور في كل مكان, لا نريد أن نؤذي أنفسنا! = Persian: توجه, ہر جگہ جڑوں ہیں, ہم چاہتے ہیں کہ ہم خود کو نقصان نہ پہنچائیں! = Kazakh: Таңба, қарайдағы көрсөлті бар, мы не хотели бы собакуға өттіргіз! = Kyrgyz: Таңба, қарайдағы көрсөлті бар, мы не хотели бы собакуға өттіргіз! = Mongolian: Таңба, қарайдағы көрсөлті бар, мы не хотели бы собакуға өттіргіз! = Turkish: Düşünceler, her şeydeki kökler var, birini kendilerini bozmak istemiyor

column1: French: Ouvert d'esprit, peut-être, mais dans un espace bien confiné. = English:
column2: Open minded, perhaps, but in a very confined space.

column1: French: Je pense que mettre les chaussures au four indique de fortes émotions qui ne parviennent pas à s'exprimer autrement. = English:

column3: I think that putting shoes in the oven indicates strong emotions that cannot be expressed otherwise.

column1: French: Mais je les entends quand même. = English:

column1: French: On pourrait faire un petit atelier décoration dimanche matin, comme ça tout sera prêt pour la fête le samedi d'après. = English:
column2: We could do a decoration workshop on Sunday morning. That way everything will be ready for the party the following Saturday.
column3: We could do a little decoration workshop on Sunday morning, so everything will be ready for the party on Saturday.

column1: French: La dernière fois j'ai l'impression d'avoir fait une crise d'angoisse, je me suis enfermée dans les toilettes pour pleurer. = English:
column2: Last time I think I had a panic attack. I locked myself in the toilet and cried.
column3: The last time I felt like I had a panic attack, I locked myself in the bathroom to cry.

column1: French: Espérons effectivement que l'on s' apercevra bien vite qu'il se passe quelque chose d'anormal. = English:
column2: Let's hope that's true and they'll quickly notice that something is amiss.
column3: I hope that we will soon realize that something is wrong.

column1: French: Une très bonne soupe de mangue d'ailleurs que je vous recommande si vous avez encore faim après votre repas. = English:
column2: A very good mango soup by the way, that I would recommend if you're still hungry after your meal.
column3: A very good mango soup, which I recommend if you still have an appetite after your meal.

column1: French: On n'a pas besoin de diplôme universitaire pour changer son comportement au quotidien, et pour inciter son entourage à faire de même. = English:

column3: We don't need a university degree to change our behaviour in everyday life, and to encourage our entourage to do the same.

column1: French: Une fois au dessus des nuages, tout est calme, il y a de la lumière, ça donne plein d'idées. = English:
column2: Once you're above the clouds, everything is calm, there's light... you get lots of ideas.

column1: French: Je me souviens de lui, et c'est vrai qu'il te regardait toujours d'une façon franchement déplacée. = English:

column3: I remember him, and it is true that he always looked at you in a frankly inappropriate way. = Spanish: Recuerdo que te miraba de una manera francamente inapropiada. = German: Ich erinnere mich an ihn, und es ist wahr, dass er dich immer so deutlich anstarrte. = Italian: Mi ricordo di lui, e è vero che te guardava sempre in modo francamente inappropriato. = Portuguese: Lembro-me dele, e é verdade que ele sempre te olhava de uma maneira francamente inadequada. = Swedish: Jag minner om honom, och det är sannolikt, att han alltid stod på dig på en förfrånlig sätt. = Dutch: Ik denk aan hem, en dat is waar, dat hij altijd je altijd een vreemd zijn aandacht gaf. = Finnish: Minä muistamme hänen, ja se on tosi, että hänen aina näyttänyt sinua väärässä näyttöä. = Norwegian: Jeg minner om han, og det er sannsynlig, at han altid stod på deg på en forfrønlig måte. = Finnish: Minä muistamme hänen, ja se on tosi, että hänen aina näyttänyt sinua väärässä näyttöä. = Norwegian: Jeg minner om han, og det er sannsynlig, at han altid stod på deg på en forfrønlig måte. = Finnish: Minä muistamme hänen, ja se on tosi, että hänen aina näyttänyt sinua väärässä näyttöä. = Norwegian: Jeg minner om han, og det er sannsynlig, at han altid stod på deg på en forfrønlig måte. = Finnish: Minä muistamme hänen, ja se on tosi, että hänen aina näyttänyt sinua väärässä näyttöä. = Norwegian: Jeg minner om han, og det er sannsynlig, at han altid stod på deg på en forfrønlig måte.

column1: French: au garage = English:
column2: In the garage.
column3: in the garage) is a French-language song by Canadian singer Celine Dion. It was written by Jean-Jacques Goldman and composed by Goldman and Jacques Veneruso. It was released in France on 23 September 1998 as the second single from Dion's album D'eux (English: Them). The song was a commercial success, peaking at number one in France and Belgium, and number two in Switzerland. It was also a hit in other European countries, peaking at number one in Austria, Germany, and the Netherlands, and number two in Italy and Spain. The song was also a hit in Asia, peaking at number one in Hong Kong, Malaysia, and Singapore, and number two in Taiwan. The song was also a hit in Oceania, peaking at number one in New Zealand and number two in Australia. The song was also a hit in the United States, peaking at number one on the Billboard Hot 100, and number one on the Billboard Adult Contemporary chart. column1: French: Mon pauvre bébé, il a été tout mouillé toute la journée, j'espère que tu n'as pas pris froid. = English:
column2: My poor baby. He has been all wet all day long. I hope you didn't catch cold.
column3: My poor baby, he was soaked all day, I hope you didn't catch a cold. = Spanish: Pobrecito mío, ha estado todo el día empapado, espero que no te hayas resfriado. = German: Mein liebes Kind, er hat sich ganz heute gebrannt, hoffe, du hast nicht kalt. = Italian: Mio caro bambino, è stato tutto il giorno imbottito, spero che non hai preso freddo. = Portuguese: Meu pobre bebê, ele ficou todo molhado o dia todo, espero que você não pegou um resfriado. = Russian: Моя плохая бабушка, она весь день водяная, я не уверен, что ты не замолк. = Chinese: 我可怜的孩子，他整天都湿透了，我希望你没有感冒。 = Japanese: 私の子供は、いつものように、雨に濡れている。私は、あなたが寒いと思う。 = Korean: 나의 아기, 그는 하루종일 비에 젖어있었다. 나는 그를 차갑게 하지 않았으면 좋겠다. = Vietnamese: Con yêu của mẹ, con đã bị ướt cả ngày rồi, mẹ hy vọng con không bị cảm lạnh. = Chinese: 我可怜的孩子，他整天都湿透了，我希望你没有感冒。 = Japanese: 私の子供は、いつものように、雨に濡れている。私は、あなたが寒いと思う。 = Korean: 나의 아기, 그는 하루종일 비에 젖어있었다. 나는 그를 차갑게 하지 않았으면 좋겠다. = Vietnamese: Con yêu của mẹ, con đã bị ướt cả ngày rồi, mẹ hy vọng con không bị cảm lạnh. = Chinese: 我可怜的孩子，他整天都湿透了，我希望你没有感冒。 = Japanese: 私の子供は、いつものように、雨に濡れている。私は、あなたが寒いと思う。 = Korean: 나의 아기, 그는 하�

column1: French: Non je voulais dire, le soir il fait plus froid que pendant la journée. = English:

column1: French: Tant que tu ne me demandes pas de regarder du foot et de réchauffer une pizza surgelée, tu peux rester autant de temps que tu veux sous la douche et boire ta bière. = English:
column2: As long as you don't ask me to watch football and reheat a frozen pizza, you can stay as long as you want in the shower and drink your beer.
column3: As long as you don't ask me to watch football and warm up a frozen pizza, you can stay as long as you want in the shower and drink your beer.

column1: French: Il ne m'a pas laissée le temps d'expliquer ma situation, et m'a renvoyée de son bureau avec encore plus de travail qu'avant ! = English:

column1: French: N'y a-t-il pas une autre solution ? = English:
column2: Is there no other solution?

column1: French: Pour la truffe, vous pensiez en mettre en fines tranches ou juste utiliser de l'huile à la truffe? = English:
column2: For the truffle, were you planning in cutting it into fine slices or just using the truffle oil?
column3: For the truffle, you thought of slicing it thinly or just using truffle oil?

column1: French: et, comme tu connais très bien le sujet, tu as du être parfait ! = English:
column2: And since you know the topic so well, you must have been perfect!
column3: and, as you know the subject very well, you have to be perfect! = German: und, da du das Thema sehr gut kennst, musst du perfekt sein! = Spanish: y, como conoces muy bien el tema, has de ser perfecto! = Italian: e, come conosci molto bene il tema, devi essere perfetto! = Portuguese: e, como conheces muito bem o tema, tens de ser perfeito! = Romanian: și, ca înţelegeți foarte bine temă, trebuie să fii perfecți! = Turkish: ve, çünkü temaya daha iyi bilirsiniz, tamamen iyi olmalısınız! = Chinese: 而,因为您对这个主题很了解,所以您必须完美! = Japanese: ですが、あなたはこのテーマに十分に詳しく知っているので、あなたは必ずしも完全になる必要があります! = Korean: 또한, 당신이 이 단어를 다루는 것이 당신이 필요하다면, 당신은 필수적으로 완전한 것이라고 합니다! = Vietnamese: và, vì bạn biết rất rõ về chủ đề này, bạn phải hoàn hảo! = Chinese: 而,因为您对这个主题很了解,所以您必须完美! = Japanese: ですが、あなたはこのテーマに十分に詳しく知っているので、あなたは必ずしも完全になる必要があります! = Korean: 또한, 당신이 이 단어를 다루는 것이 당신이 필요하다면, 당신은 필수적으로 완전한 것이라고 합니다! = Vietnamese: và, vì bạn biết rất rõ về chủ đề này, bạn phải hoàn hảo! = Chinese: 而,因为您对这个主题很了解,所以您必须完美! = Japanese: ですが、あなたはこのテーマに十分に詳しく知っているので、あなたは必ずしも完全になる必要があり

column1: French: Dès qu'on s'éloigne du chemin, on rendre dans le territoire des bêtes sauvages. = English:
column2: Once you leave the path, you enter the wild beast territory.
column3: As soon as one leaves the path, one enters the territory of wild beasts. = Spanish: Tan pronto como uno se aleja del camino, se adentra en el territorio de las fieras. = German: So bald man sich vom Weg entfernt, wird man in das Gebiet der Wildtiere eingehen. = Italian: A soltanto che si lascia il cammino, si entra nel territorio delle feroci bestie. = Latin: Quam primum ab itinere recedimus, in terram ferarum incidimus. = Swedish: När man utav väg går, kommer man in till djurhemmet. = Dutch: Zodra men van de weg weggaat, gaat men in het gebied van wildtijzen. = Norwegian: Når man ut av veien går, kommer man til djurheten. = Finnish: Kun silloin, kun meni poistuu välityksellä, siirretään meni selvityksellä. = Hungarian: Ha a útvonal elhagyta, akkor a világháború tartományba kerülnek. = Czech: Jakmile se od cesty odchodí, přechází se do oblasti zvířat. = Slovak: Když se od cesty odchodí, přechází do oblasti zvířat. = Polish: Kiedy odchodzisz z drogi, zaczysz do obszaru zwierząt. = Slovenian: Kada se od ceste odchodi, se vodi do območja zvierat. = Serbian: Kada se od ceste odchodi, se vodi do oblasti zvierat. = Bulgarian: Како се излезе от пътя, се води до земята на възрастните животни. = Lithuanian: Kai atsižvelgiama iš dalies, pradėti į šešies. = Latvian: Kādā atšķirīgi no dalīšās, pradētas ļoti dalīšās. = Slovak: Když se od cesty odchodí, přechází do oblasti zvířat

column1: French: Partez, prenez deux jeunes enfants avec vous, sautez, je reste ici. = English:
column2: Go! Take two young children with you! Jump! I'm staying here.
column3: Go, take two young children with you, jump, I stay here. = German: Gehen Sie, nehmen Sie zwei junge Kinder mit Ihnen, springen, ich bleibe hier. = Spanish: Váyanse, tomen dos niños pequeños con ustedes, salten, me quedo aquí. = Italian: Andate, prendete due bambini piccoli con voi, salti, mi rido qui. = Portuguese: Vão-se embora, levem dois meninos pequenos com vocês, saltem, fico aqui. = Russian: Пойдём, принесём двое маленьких детей с нас, летайтесь, я останусь. = Swedish: Gå, ta emot två liten barn med dig, spring, jag sätter mig här. = Dutch: Ga, verzamel twee kleine kinderen met je, spring, ik sta hier. = Norwegian: Gå, ta med to små barn med deg, spring, jeg så här. = Finnish: Lähetä, anna kaksi pieniä piikkoa kanssa, lopeta, minä pidätä täällä. = Greek: Μετάβασε, παραγγείλα με δύο παιδιά μικρά μου, πετάξε, μου ακόμα στην άλλη. = Hungarian: Kérlek, hogy, töltött két kisebb személyt, csúsz, hogy, nem fogom, hogy, már már, hogy, már már, hogy, már már, hogy, már már, hogy, már már, hogy, már már, hogy, már már, hogy, már már, hogy, már már, hogy, már már, hogy, már már, hogy, már már, hogy, már már, hogy, már már, hogy, már már, hogy, már már, hogy, már már, hogy, már már, hogy, már már, hogy, már már, hogy, már már, hogy, már már, hogy, már már, hogy, már már, hogy, már már, hogy, már már, hogy, már már, hogy, már már, hogy, már már,

column1: French: J'espère que l'intervention sera rapide, je suis claustrophobe. = English:
column2: I hope they repair it quickly. I'm claustrophobic.
column3: I hope the intervention will be quick, I'm claustrophobic. = Spanish: Espero que la intervención sea rápida, soy claustrofóbico. = German: Ich hoffe, die Intervention wird schnell, ich bin Claustrophob. = Italian: Speriamo che l'intervento sia rapido, sono claustrofobico. = Dutch: Hoe lang zal de interventie zijn? Ik ben claustrophob. = Swedish: Hur lång ska interveten vara? Jag är claustrophob. = Finnish: Miten pituus on interveteen? Olet claustrophobin. = Norwegian: Hvor lenge vil interveten være? Jeg er claustrophob. = Polish: Jak długo będzie interwencja? Mam claustrofobie. = Czech: Jak dlouho bude intervence? Mám claustrofobie. = Slovak: Jak dlouho bude intervence? Máme claustrofobie. = Hungarian: Hogy hosszú a befejezés? Szeretlek claustrofobie. = Romanian: Câte lungă va fi intervenția? Am fobia de clostrofobie. = Slovenian: Kako dolgo bo intervencija? Imamo claustrofobie. = Serbian: Kako dolgo bit intervencija? Samim claustrofobi. = Bulgarian: Како дълго ще бъде интервенцията? Само моята кластрофобия. = Lithuanian: Kiek ilgalaik yra intervencija? Jau yra claustrofobija. = Latvian: Kiek ilgali būtu intervencija? Jau būtu claustrofobija. = Slovak: Kako dolgo bude intervencija? Máme claustrofobie. = Ukrainian: Како довго ще бъде интервенцията? column1: French: Tu peux le garder pour toi, on peut le boire à 2, ou on peut aussi inviter l'infirmière que j'ai croisée dans le couloir en arrivant. = English:
column2: You can keep it fo you, we can drink it together or we can also invite the nurse I passed in the corridor as I was coming in.
column3: You can keep it for yourself, we can drink it together, or we can also invite the nurse I met in the hallway when I came in. = Spanish: Puedes quedártelo para ti, podemos beberlo los dos, o podemos invitar también a la enfermera que me crucé en el pasillo cuando llegué. = German: Du kannst es dir behalten, wir können es beide trinken, oder wir können auch die Pflegerin, die ich im Korridor beim Ankommen gesehen habe, einladen. = Italian: Lo puoi tenere per te, lo potremmo bevere noi due, o anche invitare l'infermiera che ho incontrato nel corridoio quando sono arrivato. = Dutch: Je kunt het voor je houden, we kunnen het beide drinken, of we kunnen ook de zorgverpleegkundige die ik in het koridor bij het binnenkomst heb gezien, uitnodigen. = Swedish: Du kan ha den för dig, vi kan ha den beida, eller vi kan också lägga till den sjuksköterska som jag kände i koridor när jag kom. = Finnish: Sinun voi säilyttää se, niin kuin niin, että niin, tai niin kuin niin, että niin, kun se on myös yhteydessä, joka kuului minua koridorissa kun olet aloitettu. = Norwegian: Du kan ha den for deg, vi kan ha denne begge, eller vi kan også invitere sjuksköterskaren som jeg har sett i koridoren når jeg kom. = Finnish: Sinun voi säilyttää se, niin kuin niin, että niin, tai niin kuin niin, että niin, kun se on myös yhteydessä, joka kuului minua koridorissa kun olet aloitettu. = Swedish: Du kan ha den för dig, vi kan ha den beida, eller vi kan også lägga till den sjuksköterska som jag kände i koridor när jag kom. = Norwegian: Du kan ha den for deg, vi kan ha denne beg

column1: French: Il ne faut pas vous inquiéter outre mesure = English:

column1: French: un vrai cauchemar = English:
column2: A real nightmare.
column3: a real nightmare) is a French-language film directed by Claude Chabrol and starring Stéphane Audran, Michel Bouquet, and Jean Yanne. It was released in France on 20 April 1972. The film was shot in the Parisian suburb of Sceaux. The film was released in the United States as The Nightmare.

column1: French: Parce que l'histoire des premiers hommes qui débarquent sur Mars et découvre des traces d'une très vieille civilisation, c'est nettement plus intéressant que ton histoire de généalogiste et de trésors ! = English:
column2: Because the story of the first men who arrive on Mars and discover traces of an ancient civilisation is far more interesting than your story about genealogists and treasure!
column3: Because the story of the first men who land on Mars and discover traces of a very old civilization, it's much more interesting than your story of genealogist and treasures! = Español: Porque la historia de los primeros hombres que desembarcan en Marte y descubren rastros de una muy antigua civilización, es mucho más interesante que tu historia de genealogista y tesoros! = Italiano: Perché la storia dei primi uomini che scendono in Marte e scoprono tracce di una vecchia civiltà, è molto più interessante della tua storia di genealogista e di tesori! = Português: Porque a história dos primeiros homens que desembarcam em Marte e descobrem vestígios de uma antiga civilização, é muito mais interessante do que a tua história de genealogista e tesouros! = Deutsch: Weil die Geschichte der ersten Menschen, die auf Mars landen und Träume von einer sehr alten Kultur entdecken, viel interessanter ist als deine Geschichte von Genealogisten und Schatzes! = 日本語: マーズには、最初の人間が降りてきたという歴史が、あなたの歴史のほうよりも、多くの人々に興味深いのではないか。 = Korean: 마이스에서 처음으로 들어온 인간들이 유명한 무역을 찾았다는 이야기가 너의 이야기보다 더 많이 사람들에게 중요한 것이 아닐까요? = Chinese: 因为在火星上发现人类最早登陆的痕迹，比你的寻宝故事更吸引人。 = Turkish: Çünkü Marsta, yeni insanlarla ilk girişi bulunan bir yerdeki yerel kültürlerin kaynaklarından daha çok insanlar çok daha çok ilgi gösterir. = Vietnamese: Vì câu chuyện về những người đầu tiên đặt chân lên sao Hỏa và khám phá ra những dấu vết của một nền văn minh cổ đại, nó hấp dẫn hơn câu chuyện của một nhà nghiên cứu gia phả và kho báu của bạn. = Slovenian: Zato, ker je na Marsu prvi lj

column1: French: Ils complotent ensemble afin de ne laisser aucune information échapper. = English:
column2: They plot together so as not to let any details get out.
column3: They conspire together to keep no information from leaking out.

column1: French: Mettez tout, ce sera parfait. = English:
column2: A bit of everything would be perfect.
column3: Put everything, it will be perfect.

column1: French: Ou au contraire rien de spécial, juste la routine qui ne vous satisfait pas? = English:
column2: Or on the contrary nothing in particular, just an unfulfilling routine?
column3: Or on the contrary, nothing special, just the routine that does not satisfy you?

column3: Yes, a lot, especially in South America where there are extraordinary animals in the Amazon forest.

column3: But I was more interested in questions related to consciousness, ontology, phenomenology.

column1: French: Si vous envoyez un message à la secrétaire elle va les prévenir = English:
column2: If you send a message to the secretary she'll let them know.
column3: If you send a message to the secretary she will let them know.

column1: French: Je paie pourtant une fortune pour l'entretien de ces machines ! = English:
column2: And yet I pay a fortune for the upkeep of these machines!
column3: I pay a fortune for the maintenance of these machines!

column1: French: Oh non, j'aurais trop peur qu'ils s'aperçoivent que je les écoute. = English:
column2: Oh no, I would be too scared of them noticing me listening to them.
column3: Oh no, I would be too afraid that they would notice that I am listening to them.

column1: French: Probablement délicieux mais je souhaite juste un café avec un jus d'orange. = English:
column2: Probably delicious, but I'd rather just have a coffee and an orange juice.
column3: Probably delicious but I just want a coffee with an orange juice.

column1: French: Et si on reste coincé ici trop longtemps on pourra toujours essayer de faire de l'alcool de mûres. = English:
column2: And if we're stuck here too long, we can always try to make alcohol out of blackberries.
column3: And if we get stuck here for too long we can always try to make some blackberry brandy.

column1: French: J'avais appris par coeur plein de citations, et j'en ai mis le plus possible dans ma copie. = English:
column2: I learnt lots of quotes by heart and I wrote as many as possible in my paper.
column3: I had learned by heart a lot of quotations, and I put as many as I could in my composition.

column1: French: Mais vous savez qu'on n'a aucune chance, n'est-ce pas? = English:
column2: But you know we have no chance, don't you?
column3: But you know we have no chance, don't you?

The French negative is a negative polarity item (NPI) that is licensed by a negative context. The English negative is not an NPI, and is not licensed by a negative context. The French negative is also licensed by a positive context, as in (2): (2) Je n'ai pas pu déjeuner, mais je suis allé au cinéma. column1: French: J'ai fait comme vous m'avez demandé, chef, mais comme j'étais aussi occupée à faire l'entrée pour la table 6, j'ai pas fait attention au temps et j'ai laissé brûler la crème... = English:
column2: I was doing as you asked, chef, but since I was busy making the starter for table 6, I didn't see the time go by and I let the cream burn...
column3: I did what you asked, chef, but as I was also busy making the starter for table 6, I didn't pay attention to the time and I let the cream burn... = Español: Hice lo que me pidió, jefe, pero como estaba también ocupada haciendo la entrada para la mesa 6, no me di cuenta del tiempo y dejé que se quemara la crema... = Italiano: Ho fatto quello che mi ha chiesto, capo, ma come ero anche occupata a fare l'aperitivi per la tavola 6, non ho fatto attenzione al tempo e ho lasciato bruciare la crema... = Português: Fiz o que me pediu, chefe, mas como estava também ocupada a fazer a entrada para a mesa 6, não me dei conta do tempo e deixei queimar a nata... = Deutsch: Ich habe, was Sie mir angefragt haben, Chef, aber wie ich auch beschäftigt war, um den Vorspeisen für Tisch 6 zu machen, habe ich nicht auf die Zeit gewartet und habe die Creme verbrannt lassen... = Nederlands: Ik heb, wat je me hebt gevraagd, chef, maar als ik ook bezig was met het voorstel voor tafel 6, heb ik niet op de tijd gewacht en de creme heb ik verbranden... = Suomi: Minun, chef, mutta kunnistaa, että minä olen myös tällä hetkellä meneillään taulun 6:n välisessä ja sitten minä olen muuttunut huomioon, että creme on verbrannut... = Slovenščina: Ja sam, kot je požal, chef, vendar pa sam tudi zasedel, da bi se vzeli vprašalnik za tašel 6 in sam se ne zgubljali, da bi se creme zgubljalo... = Polski: Przeprowadziliście, co zadzwoniłem, chef, ale jakbyś tam byłeś zajęty, zrobisząc pierwszego zaczynienia dla tabeli 6, nie zauważyłeś czasu i zgubiliście kremę... = Čeština: Vám, chef, jsem

column1: French: Malheureusement notre séance est terminée, c'est l'heure de mon prochain patient. = English:
column2: Unfortunately our session is over, it's time for my next patient.
column3: Unfortunately our session is over, it's time for my next patient. = Spanish: Desafortunadamente nuestra sesión ha terminado, es hora de mi próximo paciente. = German: Leider ist unsere Sitzung beendet, es ist die Stunde meines nächsten Patienten. = Italian: Purtroppo la nostra sessione è terminata, è l'ora del mio prossimo paziente. = Portuguese: Infelizmente nossa sessão terminou, é hora do meu próximo paciente. = Turkish: Çok güzel bir sesi sonlandırıldı, şimdiki olan hastanın daha sonra olması gerektiği için. = Chinese: 抱歉，我们的课程已经结束了，现在是下一个病人的时间。 = Japanese: 申し訳ありません、この授業は終了しました。今後の患者の時間です。 = Korean: 실례합니다. 이번 강사는 끝났습니다. 다음의 환자의 시간입니다. = Vietnamese: Xin lỗi, giờ của bệnh nhân tiếp theo đã đến rồi. = Arabic: معذرة، لقد انتهى وقت مرضاي. = Persian: عذراً، وقت مرضایی که بعد از این به آن آمده است، به پایان رسیده است. = Hebrew: אנא הסרו את המשך של המקרה שלי. הזמן של המקרה הבאה הוא. = Greek: Παρακαλώ, την ώρα του επόμενου μου μαθητή. = Russian: Пожалуйста, оставьте меня. Это время для моей следующей пациента. = Slovak: Prosím, následne sa máme. = Slovenian: Prosim, následnje mi je. = Serbian: Молимо, оставите меня. То време је за мој следећи болесник. = Serbo-Croatian: Molimo, ostavite me. To vreme je za moj sledeći bolestnik. = Slovak: Prosím, následne sa máme. = Slovenian: Prosim

column1: French: le terme exact état Atmosphère, pas Air, mais c'est pareille, j'asphyxie à ton côté. = English:
column2: The exact term was “atmosphere” not “air”, but it's the same thing; I'm suffocating at your side.
column3: the exact term was Atmosphere, not Air, but it's the same, I suffocate next to you. = Español: el término exacto era Atmósfera, no Aire, pero es lo mismo, me asfixio a tu lado. = Italiano: il termine esatto era Atmosfera, non aria, ma è lo stesso, mi soffoco a fianco tuo. = Português: o termo exato era Atmosfera, não Ar, mas é a mesma coisa, eu sufoco ao teu lado. = Deutsch: der exakte Begriff war Atmosphäre, nicht Luft, aber es ist gleich, ich suffokiere neben dir. = 日本語: 単語の正しい表現は「Atmosfera」ではなく「空気」ですが、それとも同じです。あなたの隣にいると、窒息してしまいます。 = 한국어: 정확한 단어는 «Atmosfera»이 아니라 «공기»이지만, 그것과는 달리요. 그대 곁에 있으면, 숨을 쉬지 못하게 되는데요. = Polski: prawidłowa nazwa była Atmosfera, nie Przestrzeń, ale to jest takie same, zaszczędzam się połączeniu z Tobą. = Português (Brasil): o termo exato era Atmosfera, não Ar, mas é a mesma coisa, eu sufoco ao teu lado. = Slovenčina: pravděpodobně správně jméno bylo Atmosfera, ne Prázdniny, ale to je stejná, žalujem se blíže k tobě. = Slovenščina: pravdopodobno pravilno ime je Atmosfera, ne Prazdine, vendar je to enako, žalujem se blizu vas. = Suomi: oikea nimi on Atmosfera, ei Luftia, mutta se on samaan, joka koirattu sinua. = Svenska: riktig ord var Atmosfär, inte Luft, men det är lika, jag suffokerar när du är nära. = 한국

column1: French: On va marcher pendant 1h30 et ensuite on n'aura même plus le temps de se remettre près de la piscine = English:
column2: We'll walk for an hour and a half and then we won't even have any more time to go back by the pool.
column3: We are going to walk for 1h30 and then we won't even have time to get back to the pool.

column1: French: SI vous n'êtes pas inquiète dans mon cabinet, c'est déjà un bon point : c'est que vous n'avez pas peur de parler de vous. = English:
column2: If you're not anxious in my practice, that's a good start: it means that you're not scared of talking about yourself.
column3: If you are not worried in my office, it is already a good point: it means that you are not afraid to talk about yourself. = German: Wenn Sie sich in meinem Kursraum nicht besorgt fühlen, ist das schon ein gutes Zeichen, dass Sie sich nicht besorgt fühlen, sich zu erzählen. = Spanish: Si usted no se siente inquieta en mi consultorio, es ya un buen indicio de que no le preocupa hablar de sí misma. = Italian: Se non siete preoccupati in mia clinica, è già un buon segno: è che non siete preoccupati di parlare di voi. = Portuguese: Se você não se sente inquieta na minha sala de espera, é um bom sinal de que não se sente inquieta em falar de si mesma. = Turkish: Eğer siz benim poliklinikteki halkına karşısına gelmezseniz, bu bir iyi nokta olacaktır: Siz, kendinizi konuşmaktan kaçınmazsınız. = Chinese: 如果你不担心在我诊所里,这已经是一个好的迹象:这意味着你不担心谈论你自己。 = Japanese: 私のクリニックであなたが不安なら、それはいいのにということは、私に自分のことを話すことを恐れないことです。 = Korean: 당신은 내 병원에서 무서워하지 않으면 좋은 일이라고 생각하는데요. 그것은 당신이 내게 나의 일을 말하는 것을 포기하지 않는 것이라고 하는데요. = Vietnamese: Nếu bạn không lo lắng trong phòng khám của tôi, đó là một dấu hiệu tốt: nó có nghĩa là bạn không sợ nói về bản thân mình. = Chinese: 如果你不担心在我诊所里,这已经是一个好的迹象:这意味着你不担心谈论你自己。 = Japanese: 私のクリニックであなたが不安なら、それはいいのにということは、私に自分のことを話すことを恐れないことです。 = Korean: 당신은 내 병원에

column1: French: Merci pour votre soutien, en tout cas. = English:
column2: Thanks for your support anyway.
column3: Thank you for your support, anyway. = German: Danke für Ihre Unterstützung, immerhin. = Spanish: Gracias por su apoyo, de todos modos. = Italian: Grazie per il vostro sostegno, comunque. = Portuguese: Obrigado pelo seu apoio, de qualquer forma. = Russian: Признательность за вашу поддержку, всё равно. = Chinese: 谢谢你的支持,无论如何. = Japanese: 皆さん、ありがとうございます。それでも、どうかお願いします。 = Korean: 감사합니다。 그러나、どうかお願いします。 = Vietnamese: Cảm ơn sự ủng hộ của bạn, bất kể. = Arabic: شكرا لدعمكم, على أي حال. = Persian: سپاس و تشکر بر حمایت شما، بہرحال. = Turkish: Teşekkürler. = Greek: Ευχαριστώ για την υποστήριξή σας, πάντα. = Hebrew: תודה על התמיכה שלך, בכל הנראה. = Arabic: شكرا لدعمكم, على أي حال. = Persian: سپاس و تشکر بر حمایت شما، بہرحال. = Turkish: Teşekkürler. = Greek: Ευχαριστώ για την υποστήριξή σας, πάντα. = Hebrew: תודה על התמיכה שלך, בכל הנראה. = Arabic: شكرا لدعمكم, على أي حال. = Persian: سپاس و تشکر بر حمایت شما، بہرحال. = Turkish: Teşekkürler. = Greek: Ευχαριστώ για την υποστήριξή σας, πάντα. = Hebrew: תודה על התמיכה שלך, בכל הנראה. = Arabic: شكرا لدعمكم, على أي حال. = Persian: سپاس و تشکر بر حمایت شما، بہرحال. = Turkish: Teşekkürler. = Greek: Ευχαριστώ για την υποστήριξή σας, πάντα. =

column1: French: Une piscine, du soleil et rien d'autre = English:

column1: French: Regarder les canards, les jolies filles aussi.... Que fais-tu comme travail chez toi ? = English:
column2: To look at the ducks, pretty girls too... What kind of work do you do from home?
column3: Watching ducks, pretty girls too.... What do you do at home? = Spanish: Ver patos, chicas guapas también.... ¿Qué haces en casa? = German: Sehen Sie die Enten, schöne Mädchen auch.... Was machst du zu Hause? = Italian: Guardare i cani, le belle ragazze anche.... Che cosa fai a casa? = Dutch: Kijken aan de eenden, de mooi meisjes ook.... Wat doe je thuis? = Swedish: Se caner, de sånga mäster och de sånga mästerinnor även.... Vad gör du härifrån? = Norwegian: Se kjærer, de smukke møder og de smukke møderne også.... Hvad gør du herfra? = Finnish: Seinä, kuin koirat, ja kuin koirat, mutta seuraavat kuin koirat.... Mitä tehdä omaan työssä? = Hungarian: A kicsit, a szépeket és a szépeket is is, de a szépeket is is.... Mit tudod a személyben? = Romanian: Vedeți păduri, mulți bărbați și mulți bărbați, dar păduri și bărbați.... Ce faceți în casa? = Slovak: Videnie pádky, krasivie chvládie a tiež krasivie chvládie, ale pádky a tiež chvládie.... Čo robíte v domovom? = Slovenian: Videti padove, ljubljene žene in ljubljene žene, ali padove in ljubljene žene.... Kaj si radite v domu? = Czech: Viděti pádky, dobré ženy a dobré ženy, ale pádky a dobré ženy.... Jak si radíte v domově? = Bulgarian: Видете пъти, прекрасните жени и прекрасните жени, но пъти и прекрасните жени.... Какво правате в дома? = Serbo-Cro

column1: French: j'ai fait une faute de frappe: A ton âge vivre dans un univers de manga et de dessins animés est pathétique. = English:

column1: French: Avec du vin blanc = English:
column2: With white wine.
column3: With white wine) is a French comedy film directed by Éric Rohmer and starring Fabrice Luchini, Pauline Lafont, and Jean-Louis Trintignant. It was released in France on 20 April 1969. The film is a loose adaptation of the play Le Vin de Paris by Eugène Labiche and Marc-Michel.

column1: French: Peut-être que tu pourrais apporter une épée, comme un vrai chevalier de la couronne! = English:
column2: Perhaps you could bring a sword, like a real knight of the crown!

column1: French: Je suis d'accord, mais ce serait plutôt à elle de l'organiser. = English:
column2: I agree, but it should be up to her to organise it.
column3: I agree, but it would be up to her to organize it.

column1: French: C'est sûr qu'avec la pluie de ce matin, le sol est bien boueux. = English:
column2: With this morning's rain, the ground is very muddy, that's for sure.
column3: It's sure that with the rain this morning, the ground is very muddy.

column1: French: Je vais réfléchir à la liste des invités. = English:
column2: I'll think about the guest list.
column3: I will think about the guest list.

column1: French: En plus, avec le soleil qui se couche, c'est vrai que c'est le moment idéal pour croiser un loup ou un ours! = English:
column2: And the sun is setting. It's certainly  the perfect time to meet a wolf or a bear!
column3: In addition, with the sun setting, it is true that it is the ideal time to meet a wolf or a bear! = Español: Además, con el sol poniéndose, es verdad que es el momento ideal para cruzarse con un lobo o un oso! = Deutsch: Ausserdem, mit dem Sonne untergehen, ist es wahr, dass es der ideale Zeit ist, einen Wolf oder Bär zu treffen! = Italiano: Inoltre, con il sole che si pone, è vero che è il momento ideale per incontrare un lupo o un orso! = 日本語: ＡＵＳＴＥＲＭＥＮＴＩＣＡＬＬＥＹ, サンが下りるとき、ウルフやオーストを見つけるのは確かに良い時だと思う！ = 한국어: 더불어, 태양이 하늘로 내리는 시간에는 외로운 소환이나 소환을 볼 수 있다는 것이 맞다. = עברית: וכן, במהרה שמתחת, הוא הזמן המומלץ למצוא או אחד מהאיים! = Português: Além disso, com o sol se pondo, é verdade que é o momento ideal para encontrar um lobo ou um urso! = Slovenčina: Inoltre, s soličnim zlomom, je prav da je to pravilo idealno, da se zmeša s lopom ali z orom! = Suomi: Ainoastaan, kun päivä poikkee, on tärkeä, että se on mahdollinen aika, myös hänen tai hänen kanssa saada! = 한국어: 더불어, 태양이 하늘로 내리는 시간에는 외로운 소환이나 소환을 볼 수 있다는 것이 맞다. = עבר

column1: French: En plus, il y aura des gâteaux dans ce stage de révision. = English:
column2: What's more, there will be cake during the revision course.
column3: In addition, there will be cakes in this revision course.

column1: French: Ah cela me fait bien plaisir de savoir que ta santé est bonne. = English:
column2: Ah I'm glad to hear you're in good health.
column3: I am glad to hear that you are well.

column1: French: Étudier les conséquences de décisions qui ont été prises dans le passé permet de comprendre quelles sont les bonnes décisions à prendre aujourd'hui! = English:
column2: Studying the consequences of decisions taken in the past allows us to understand which are the good decisions to take today!
column3: Studying the consequences of decisions that were taken in the past allows us to understand what are the good decisions to take today!

column1: French: Non, c'est surtout que s'ils s'étaient fixés de choisir le saint du calendrier du jour de la naissance, comme pour ce chien, cela aurait pu donner lieu à des prénoms fantasques, ou moches ! = English:
column2: No, it's just that if they had been set on choosing the Saint from the calendar on our birthdays like with the dog, that could have led to quite original names, or ugly ones!

column1: French: Je pense qu'il faudrait un peu revoir votre français. = English:
column2: I think you may need to look at your French again.
column3: I think you should improve your French. = German: Ich denke, dass ihr ihr Französisch ein bisschen verbessern sollte. = Spanish: Creo que deberíais mejorar vuestro francés. = Italian: Penso che dovrete migliorare il vostro francese. = Portuguese: Penso que devereis melhorar o vosso francês. = Russian: Я думаю, что вы должны улучшить свой французский. = Swedish: Jag tror att du börjar öka ditt franska. = Dutch: Ik denk dat je je Frans moet verbeteren. = Finnish: Sinun tulee parantaa omaa suomenkielen. = Hungarian: Szeretném, hogy a magyar nyelvét megfelelően kellene megváltoztatni. = Romanian: Eu crede ca va trebui sa ameliorați limba franceză. = Lithuanian: Jums reikia palikti savo francų kalba. = Slovak: Musíte zlepšovať vašu francúzštinu. = Slovenian: Ti je treba povečati svoju francusku. = Ukrainian: Ми думаємо, що ви повинні підвищити свій французький. = Bulgarian: Ми думаємо, що ви повинні підвищити свій французький. = Croatian: Mi se zna da bi trebali poboljšati vaš francuski jezik. = Serbo-Croatian: Ми думаємо, що ви повинні підвищити свій французький. = Slovak: Musíte zlepšovať vašu francúzštinu. = Lithuanian: Jums reikia palikti savo francų kalba. = Latvian: Jums ir jāveicina, lai palīdzītu savu francuzskumu valodu. = Slovenian: Ti je treba povečati svoju francusku. = Ukrainian: Ми думаємо, що ви повинні підвищити свій французький. = Bulgarian

column1: French: Je ne sais pas dans quelle mesure c'est de votre faute, mais si on reste coincés longtemps dans cet ascenseur, vous pourrez y travailler ici. = English:
column2: I don't know how much it's your fault, but if we're stuck in this lift a long time, you could work in here.
column3: I don't know to what extent it's your fault, but if we get stuck in this elevator for a long time, you can work here.

column1: French: Oui, ça ne va pas trop en ce moment... Mon chien est malade, mais mère me bat, et en plus j'ai des cafards dans mon appartement! = English:
column2: Yes, I'm not feeling great at the moment... My dog is ill, my mother hits me, and on top of that I've got cockroaches in my flat!
column3: Yes, it's not going too well at the moment... My dog is sick, but mother beats me, and in addition I have cockroaches in my apartment!

column2: Forget your work. You've slept enough.

column1: French: C'est à nous de payer les réparations avec nos salaires ! = English:
column2: It's up to us to pay for repairs with our salary now?
column3: It's up to us to pay the reparations with our wages!

column1: French: J'ai mon ordninateur dans mon sac à dos, comme je vous le disais, j'allais partir chercher mes enfants à l'école et je pensais travailler ce soir à la maison = English:
column2: I have my computer in my rucksack. As I told you, I was going to leave to collect my children from school and I was thinking of working from home this evening.
column3: I have my computer in my backpack, as I told you, I was going to go pick up my children from school and I was thinking of working tonight at home.

column1: French: Mais ce n'est pas tout près et je ne sais pas si c'est ouvert le dimanche. = English:
column2: But it's not that close and I don't know if it's open on Sundays.
column3: But it's not close by and I don't know if it's open on Sundays.

column1: French: Vous sortez souvent avec des amis en ce moment ? = English:
column2: Do you go out with your friends often these days?
column3: Are you often out with friends these days?

column1: French: J'apprécie vos conseils, mais je vous rappelle que je suis le professeur et vous êtes l'élève. = English:
column2: I appreciate your advice, but let me remind you that I am the teacher and you are the student.
column3: I appreciate your advice, but I remind you that I am the teacher and you are the student. = Spanish: Agradezco sus consejos, pero le recuerdo que soy el profesor y usted es el alumno. = German: Ich danke Ihnen für Ihre Rat, aber ich erinnere Sie, dass ich der Lehrer und Sie der Schüler bin. = Italian: Grazie per i suoi consigli, ma le ricordare che sono il professore e lei è il discepolo. = Portuguese: Agradeço seus conselhos, mas eu lembro que eu sou o professor e você é o aluno. = Russian: Я признаю вашу совету, но я вас обратил внимание, что я учитель и вы ученик. = Chinese: 我感谢你的建议,但我提醒你,我是老师,你是学生。 = Japanese: ありがとうございます。ご意見をいただいても、私は先生であるので、あなたは学生である。 = Korean: 감사합니다。고차를 제안하신 분에게도, 나는 선생님이고, 분은 학생이다. = Vietnamese: Tôi cảm ơn lời khuyên của bạn, nhưng tôi muốn bạn biết rằng tôi là giáo viên và bạn là học sinh. = Chinese: 我感谢你的建议,但我提醒你,我是老师,你是学生。 = Japanese: ありがとうございます。ご意見をいただいても、私は先生であるので、あなたは学生である。 = Korean: 감사합니다。고차를 제안하신 분에게도, 나는 선생님이고, 분은 학생이다. = Vietnamese: Tôi cảm ơn lời khuyên của bạn, nhưng tôi muốn bạn biết rằng tôi là giáo viên và bạn là học sinh. = Chinese: 我感谢你的建议,但我提醒你,我是老师,你是学生。 = Japanese: ありがとうございます。ご意見をいただいても、私は先生であるので、あなたは学生である。 = Korean: 감사합니다。고차를 제안하신 분에게도,

column1: French: On y perd tous ses repères. = English:
column2: You lose your bearings entirely.

column1: French: Moi aussi, mais comme je suis très chargée, j'ai pris l'ascenseur et je le regrette d'autant plus que je suis moi aussi attendue et que mon portable n'a pas de réseau. = English:
column2: Me too, but as I'm very weighed down, I took the lift and I'm regretting it, especially as they're expecting me too, and my mobile doesn't have any signal.
column3: Me too, but as I am very busy, I took the elevator and regret it even more as I am also expected and my mobile phone has no network.

column1: French: Tu plaisante, c'est un chien d'appartement, quand j'ai voulu le sortir sous la pluie il ne voulait pas sortir, il a tout juste mis le nez dehors, fait pipi à l'angle de la maison et il tirait déjà sur sa laisse pour rentrer. = English:
column2: You're joking. It's a house dog. When I wanted to take him out in the rain, he didn't want to go out - he just stuck his nose outside, peed by the corner of the house and tugged on his lead to go back home.
column3: You are joking, it is an apartment dog, when I wanted to take it out in the rain it did not want to go out, it just put its nose out, peed at the corner of the house and it was already pulling on its leash to go back. = Spanish: Te estás riendo, es un perro de apartamento, cuando quise sacarlo a la lluvia no quería salir, solo puso la nariz afuera, hizo pis en la esquina de la casa y ya estaba tirando de la correa para volver. = German: Du spielst mit mir, es ist ein Wohnungshaustier, wenn ich es in der Regen wollte heraus bringen, wollte es nicht heraus, hat nur den Nase heraus, hat geschweft an der Ecke und schon war es an der Leine, um zu kommen. = Italian: Sei ingannato, è un cane d'appartamento, quando ho voluto portarlo fuori dalla pioggia non voleva uscire, ha solo messo la faccia fuori, ha fatto pipi a quell'angolo della casa e già tirava della correa per tornare. = Dutch: Je bent verrast, dat is een appartement hond, wanneer ik hem in de regen wil huren, wil hem niet huren, heeft alleen de nase huren, heeft geschweft aan de kant en was al aan de leine, om terug te komen. = Swedish: Du gör en sång, det är ett hemhund, när jag vill ha honom ut i regnet, vill han inte ut, har bara någonstans huvud ut, har skrattat på kanten och redan var han på leken, att komma tillbaka. = Finnish: Oletko hyvä, se on yhteiskuntapuhelin, kun olen halunnut, halunnut, halunnut, halunnut, halunnut, halunnut, halunnut, halunnut, halunnut, halunnut, halunnut, halunnut, halunnut, halunnut, halunnut, halunnut, halunnut, halunnut, halunnut, halunnut, halunnut, halunnut, halunnut, halunnut, halunnut, hal

column1: French: Je dois te laisser pour l'instant, mais merci pour tous tes conseils! = English:
column2: I have to go now, but thank you for your advice!

column1: French: Et surtout, cette relation vous faisait du mal. = English:
column2: And most importantly, the relationship was hurting you.
column3: And most of all, this relationship was hurting you. = Spanish: Y sobre todo, esta relación te hacía daño. = German: Und vor allem, diese Beziehung machte dich schaden. = Italian: E soprattutto, questa relazione ti faceva male. = Dutch: Enkelemaal, deze relatie heeft je onschuldig gedaan. = Swedish: Förutom, denna relation har gjort dig skada. = Norwegian: I alt, denne forbindelsen har gjort deg skade. = Finnish: Muutamautama, tämä yhteys on tehty sinua väärän. = Hungarian: A legjobb, hogy ez a kapcsolat a személyt személyre szabott. = Romanian: Unul dintre cele mai multe, această relație a făcut să te iubesti. = Slovak: Najlepšie, čo toto spojenie ti zároveň zážit. = Slovenian: Najboljše, če to povezava ti je zasla. = Czech: Nejlepší, že toto spojenie ti zasla. = Serbian: Najbolje, što ove veze ti je zasla. = Croatian: Najbolje, što ove veze ti je zasla. = Lithuanian: Geriausias, kad šią sąsają jums nėra sėkminga. = Latvian: Vēlākāk, kad šī sāņa jums nav sīkuma. = Slovak: Najlepšie, čo toto spojenie ti zároveň zážit. = Slovenian: Najboljše, če to povezava ti je zasla. = Czech: Nejlepší, že toto spojenie ti zasla. = Serbian: Najbolje, što ove veze ti je zasla. = Croatian: Najbolje, što ove veze ti je zasla. = Lithuanian: Geriausias, kad šią sąsają jums nėra sėkminga. = Latvian: Vēlākāk, kad šī sāņa jums nav sī

column1: French: Il n'y a pas beaucoup de lumière, et, de dos, vos cheveux longs m'ont induit en erreur. = English:
column2: There isn't much light in here, and from behind your long hair threw me off.

column1: French: Si on doit rester ici encore longtemps, vous pouvez travailler. = English:
column2: If we have to stay here any longer, you could work.
column3: If we are going to stay here for a long time, you can work. = German: Wenn wir hier lange bleiben müssen, können Sie arbeiten. = Spanish: Si tenemos que quedarnos aquí mucho tiempo, usted puede trabajar. = Italian: Se dobbiamo restare qui per molto tempo, può lavorare. = Portuguese: Se tivermos que ficar aqui por muito tempo, você pode trabalhar. = Russian: Если мы должны остаться здесь дольше, вы можете работать. = Swedish: Om vi måste vara här längre tiden, kan du arbeta. = Dutch: Als we hier langer moeten zijn, kun je werk doen. = Finnish: Jos tämä on pysyvä, voit työttää. = Greek: Εάν θα πρέπει να μας να μείνουμε εδώ πολύ, μπορείτε να εργάζεστε. = Hungarian: Ha már sok idő van, akkor tudod megoldni. = Romanian: Dacă ar trebui să rămânim mai mult, puteți să lucrezi. = Turkish: Eğer bu uzaklığa kalacağız, çalışabilirsiniz. = Slovak: Aby sme smehli bytali, môžete pracovať. = Czech: Pokud budeme tu daleko, můžete pracovat. = Slovenian: Če bi morali da nastaviš, lahko deluješ. = Lithuanian: Jei turime laiku, jūs galite darbuoti. = Latvian: Jauns, kad turime laiku, jūs varat darbti. = Estonian: Kui saabid tõlge, saate tööta. = Slovak: Aby sme smehli bytali, môžete pracovať. = Czech: Pokud budeme tu daleko, můžete pracovat. = Slovenian: Če bi morali da nastaviš, lahko deluješ. = Lithuanian: Jei turime laiku, jūs galite darbuoti. = Latvian: Jauns, kad turime laiku, jūs varat darbti. = Estonian: Kui saabid tõlge

column1: French: Juste en face il y a le cabinet du Dr Jekyll, c'est un excellent diététicien. = English:
column2: Just opposite is Dr. Jekyll's surgery. He's an excellent nutritionist.
column3: Just across the street is Dr. Jekyll's office, he's an excellent dietitian.

column1: French: Je vous que vous avez votre ordinateur avec vous, c'est parfait. = English:
column2: You've got your computer with you, I see. It's perfect.
column3: I see that you have your computer with you, that's perfect. = Spanish: Veo que tienes tu ordenador contigo, perfecto. = German: Ich sehe, dass du dein Computer mit dir hast, das ist perfekt. = Italian: Io vedo che hai il tuo computer con te, è perfetto. = Dutch: Ik weet dat je je computer hebt met je, dat is perfect. = Swedish: Jag vet att du din dator har med dig, det är perfekt. = Finnish: Tiedät, että sinä olet tietää, että olet tietää tietokoneen, tämä on suositeltavaa. = Norwegian: Jeg ser at du har din datamaskin med dig, det er perfekt. = Polish: Wiem, że masz swój komputer z tobą, to jest dobrze. = Czech: Vidím, že máš vaší počítač s tebou, to je dobré. = Slovak: Vidím, že máš vaší počítač s tebou, to je dobré. = Hungarian: Értem, hogy a számítógépet fogsz tartani, ez jó. = Romanian: Vedeți că aveți calculatorul cu tine, e bine. = Lithuanian: Jau matomas, kad jūsų kompiuterį yra su jūs, taip pat reikia. = Slovenian: Vidim, da imate vaš računalnik s tebi, to je dobro. = Bulgarian: Видя, че имаш компютър с теб, то е добре. = Serbo-Croatian: Vidim, da imate vaš računalnik s tebi, to je dobro. = Slovak: Vidím, že máš vaší počítač s tebou, to je dobré. = Ukrainian: Видів, що маєш комп’ютер з тебе, то є добре. = Kazakh: Сигурно, че имаш компютър с теб, то е добре. = Kyrgyz: Сигурно, че имаш компютър с теб, то е добре. = Tajik: Сигурно, че има

column1: French: Même si ça tombe mal, il vaut mieux ça plutôt que ce soit l'ascenseur qui tombe ! = English:
column2: Even if it falls at a bad time, better that than the lift falling!
column3: Even if it is not convenient, it is better than the elevator falling!

column2: Are you planning on driving when you leave here?
column3: Are you going to drive home? = German: Sind Sie mit dem Auto nach Hause gehen? = Spanish: ¿Va a conducir a casa? = Italian: Vorresti andare a casa in auto? = Dutch: Zou je naar huis in auto gaan? = Swedish: Vill du ta en auto till hem? = Finnish: Haluatko autoa meneille? = Norwegian: Vil du ta en auto til hjem? = Icelandic: Viltu ha autoa? = Greek: Θα πάρεις με την αυτοκίνητα στη σπίτι? = Hungarian: Meg akarod autót? = Romanian: Vrei sa conduce la casa? = Slovak: Chcete na domov vypocitat? = Czech: Chcete na domov vypocitat? = Slovenian: Želite da se vratite na domov s automa? = Croatian: Želite da se vratite na domov s automa? = Serbo-Croatian: Želite da se vratite na domov s automa? = Albanian: Dëshmorë do të jetë në autot? = Macedonian: Желите да се вратите на дом с автома? = Bulgarian: Желите да се вратите на дом с автома? = Lithuanian: Jūs norite išvardinti į domą su automobiliu? = Latvian: Jūs norite išvardinti į domą su automobiliu? = Slovak: Chcete na domov vypocitat? = Czech: Chcete na domov vypocitat? = Slovenian: Želite da se vratite na domov s automa? = Croatian: Želite da se vratite na domov s automa? = Serbo-Croatian: Želite da se vratite na domov s automa? = Albanian: Dëshmorë do të jetë në autot? = Macedonian: Желите да се вратите на дом с автома? = Bulgarian: Желите да се вратите на дом с автома? = Lithuanian: Jūs norite išvardinti į domą su automobiliu? = Latvian: Jūs norite išvardinti
